description:
Update:

Moriawase ! Big Bang for your buck and perfect for fish-lover!

I got a small one $30 : 6 Chef's choice nigiri pieces AND 6 good cut sashimi pieces.

I'm stuffed!  Do it!!
author: Jessica Doan N.

description:
I really like this place!  

Quality food at decent prices.  I've had their lunch items and I was completely satisfied every time!

I keep coming back and I think you will too!
author: John M.

description:
Came for Happy Hour (4-6)! 

Must try: 

HH Sake $6 - small bottle but two bottles in did it's justice ;)

HH Sake Kama $6 - also know as salmon collar. I know it sounds obscure but DAMNNNN was it fire. The dish is smaller than normal but for 6 bucks it was a steal. If you don't know how to eat it all you have to do is squirt the lemon on the fish. Then you put the radish (its the grated white thing on the plate) into the given sauce (also on the plate). Then you just pick at the most delicious part of the salmon, dip it in the radish sauce and enjoy ! 
PS one side of the salmon is better than the other so make sure you start with that part first ;) 

SKIRTTTTTTTT steak $13? - wow guys.. the yuzu mixed with the steak was amazing. The meat was tender and perfectly cooked to a medium rare. 

Other items ordered: 

Chirashi bowl $19? - for 9 pieces of nigiri and rice it was pretty standard. The nigiri was good and the size of the slices were suffice. Nothing too special. 

Service: 
Our server was nice enough to sit us at a bigger table since it wasn't too busy. But they're pretty lax, they don't really check up on you and you have to flag them down. The place has a pretty nice ambiance and it could probably be a romantic dinner venue.

4 stars because the food is phenomenal but service is eh; not terrible but height has so much foot traffic that you would presume they would be more affiliated in qu customer service.
author: Frances K.

description:
Pretty good restaurant for some vegetarian Japanese food. They have a few good sushi options and a Tofu Steak entree. The sauce with the tofu steak was pretty delicious.
Wasn't a fan of the sushi though. The rice was very dry and was stuck to the serving dish. It was difficult to pick up the roll without it breaking apart.
author: Umang D.

description: I typically don't like raw fish but the quality here has changed my mind. Will definitely come back her again to try more items.
author: Phong D.

description: I liked this spot. It was empty. At first, I was gonna have a slice of pizza, but I decided on California roll and this was overpriced at like $8 something. But it was a good snack and I ate it. And I also got a lychee iced tea for checking in.
author: Denise C.

description: The sushi is pretty good! Didn't have the entire selection today but the recommended replacements were tasty!
author: Amit N.

description: Oysters were fresh tasting and yummy! I was down the street shopping and ended up crossing the street to see if they had Oystaz an they did. I Needed more sauce on the side so I asked for vinegar and mixed with soy, sriracha, ginger to give the oysters a little extra kick of flavor otherwise they'd be to bland.
author: Jenna B.

description:
The fish here is delicious and never fails to satisfy my cravings! The music is upbeat and the atmosphere is trendy for sure! My favorite thing to order is the Kazan roll: baked salmon on top of a California roll. Makes my mouth water! Their fish is buttery and smooth and never stringy. 
I would give this place 5 stars, but I noticed a faint toilet water smell inside the building that makes me unhappy.
author: Crystal R.

description: After posting my review I was contacted by the manager at Ginza and she apologized profusely and refunded my sushi bill. Although I'm pleased to have been given my money back, that was not my goal when I called to let them know I had gotten sick, or when writing this review. I do however think it's worth noting that they made an effort to right their wrong.
author: Bri T.

description:
In a nutshell: Food 5/5, price 4/5, service 4/5 

I came here on a Wednesday night with my bf after watching the SF Deltas soccer game at the Kezar stadium. This place is walking distance from Kezar, so that's nice and convenient. We arrived around 8:30pm and it wasn't too busy for a weekday night. 

Atmosphere: intimate and cozy with groups of friends and couples in casual attire. I came in jeans and a black jacket with black pointed boots. 
It was a chilly night. 

Check in: thanks to yelp check in, we got to try their lychee tea and it was really tasty! 

Service: service was a bit slow. We ordered a roll and it never came, but we didn't get charged for it so she probably just forgot that we had ordered it. 

Food: We both ordered chirashi and it was pretty good for around 20 bucks. I can't say that the portions are giant, but we left satisfied. 

Overall, it was a nice place to check out, the sushi was fresh and the ambiance was nice for a date night with my love.
author: Emily T.

description: Amazing sushi! I really liked the cucumber salad. I recommend being open minded when coming to this restaurant. The rolls have a lot of flavors.
author: Isabella D.

description: Always a favorite go-to spot for yummy Surf & Turf + Lychee Iced Tea. Dragon Roll + Gyu steak  we love Lychee Tea so much X 3 check-ins
author: Jennifer M.

description: Very good Japanese restaurant with great sushi rolls and amazing service.  They also have good veggie rolls.
author: Thomas P. L.

description:
I came here for dinner after some drinks at Zam Zam.  I started with a sake flight which was nice but the waiter took no effort to explain what was what.  

After writing this review a week later from when I visited, I cannot remember what I got.  Not a good sign.  I remember it being decent but clearly nothing to write home about.
author: Brandon B.

description: Ginza has good sushi with quality and fresh fish. However food service is fairly slow here, at least at lunch time on a Saturday. We ordered tea and the waitress kept us topped off. I ordered off the specials board, getting the miyabi dai(red Sea bream) and the uni special. Unfortunately they ran out of California uni, but the Hokkaido uni was delish. Still they should have removed it from the board if they didn't have it first thing at lunch. My friends got several rolls as well as the tofu steak. The tofu steak is basically agadashi tofu, though the few bites of it I had were good. The sushi rolls were also tasty, though everything was a bit pricy. I don't know what it normally costs for quality sushi in San Fran though.
author: Leon K.

description:
I found out I got a fat bonus at work and the first thing I thought of was sushi. I was too lazy to get off my ass to go somewhere so I decided to order Ginza from Eat24. This was the best idea I'd come up with all week. To my surprise the food came pretty quick, about 30 minutes. 

I ordered the $30 Moriawase, came with 6 pieces of nigiri and 6 pieces of sashimi. 2 of the sashimis were toro (fatty tuna) and it was delicious. The fish here is super fresh and the fish pieces were pretty decently sized.

I also ordered a california roll and miso soup which were also yummy. I thought the california roll was a bit pricey ($8.95?) for a roll that didn't even contain any real crab meat (it was imitation). 

Overall this place is really good and I would totally order again!
author: Sheena N.

description:
Get your sushi fix at Ginza on Haight. My bf and I swung by and enjoyed three rolls (scallop, dragon, and ca roll). In addition, we ordered chicken kaarage! All were delicious and tasty. 

I highly recommend this place for a chill, romantic dinner date with your SO. The ambiance is super chill with dance beats on the stereo and candles at each table. 

Overall, a great dining experience. Ginza satisfied my sushi cravings and did not disappoint!
author: Briana H.

description:
Of all sushi spots located in the city, I'm sure there are other places to get your fix where you don't have to wait forever to get your appetizers. Service is painfully slow, and this is coming from someone who was seated directly beside the register... Our table ordered various rolls, and a couple of appetizers, one of which was edamame. To have gotten our rolls and to have eaten halfway through said rolls with still no sign of our edamame was a huge disappointment. The sushi was pretty fair however, both in price and in taste. Being in San Francisco though, you are bound to find tastier sushi spots, prices varying of course. 

3 stars for the free lychee iced tea and free dessert
author: Brie R.

description:
The fish are definitely not very fresh, especially the 'Ankimo Pate'. I recommend DO NOT order this dish, the pate smelled very fishy, did not taste good, definitely this dish should not even be brought out to the guest's table!
The only sushi I recommend is Aburi Engawa which is Seared Halibut Fin.

There are 4 different servers who brought miso soup to our table even we already been served with miso soup. They got confused and kept coming back to our table with a bowl of miso soup.

The atmosphere is nice, sushi is mediocre, service is slow.
author: Irene X.

description:
Great fish!! 

I had the chef's choice and the fish was GREAT. Seared nigiri was on point. Check in for the lychee tea! 

My boyfriend had the steak and he loved it.
author: Ivy N.

description:
Went in on a Monday afternoon for their lunch special around 2pm and it was pretty quiet, with only a few tables occupied. They sat everyone towards the front of the restaurant where there is more light from the windows, but it was still pretty dark inside. Our server was friendly, but it took a while to get our check. I'm sure they saw my friend and I having a fun conversation, but we sat for quite a while before we were given out check. 

4 stars for a nice waitress and for a pretty speedy food service, but the ambiance and wait for the check can improve.
author: Brianna S.

description:
Favorite is the butter scallop bowl. 
Sushi and rolls are okay, felt that the seasoning for the sushi rice wasn't done enough. Lacking the after taste of sushi after eating
author: YingTung W.

description:
Rating only based on the food, not service. 

A bit overrated compared to all the amazing, highly rated reasonable sushi places in SF. 
- ordered ebi, mackerel, and albacore sushi and the ratio of fish to rice was way off. As in, a lot of rice. 
- Ankimo appetizer was good but a bit dry
- the salmon and tuna tartare cake with a chunk of guacamole and the avocado was browning already.
Flavor was still good especially with the gyoza chips.

Decent place, but not up to the par of the high reviews here.
author: Taz H.

description: The bitter experience in this restaurant. The staff are very rude and very horrible. Food is the worst. Worst sushi ever. Ambiance is ok but the customer service is very bad. Never visit this again. Not recommended at all. Waste of money and staff better learn to respect people.
author: Sai K.

description: Lovely sushi. We went for lunch today and ordered some gyoza and a Sushi Bento set, and it was lovely and fresh!
author: Maria R.

description: Fresh sushi and good prices, but service is a little slow and doesn't speak amazing English- it really wasn't an issue though! I got the spicy tuna roll and seaweed salad for the second time, and enjoyed it just as much as the first. I'm you're trynna ball on a budget, I highly recommend.
author: Samantha E.

description:
I was initially hesitant to try this place based on some of the bad reviews here but despite of a little bit of slow services , we really enjoyed their rolls. 

I took my girlfriend here who was long overdue for sushi . We usually go to Ebisu but we wanted to somewhere new we haven't tried and we are so glad to have found this place. 

They have various selections of rolls that are all amazing and fresh !
author: grace k.

description:
I came here for a late lunch/early dinner with some friends. It was an off time, so I can't really say if wait times can be long here. The food was awesome though! It took a while to come out (I think they prepare and plate it very carefully). 

I ordered the salmon in cream sauce and it came with a side of white rice and miso soup. The miso soup came out first and it was really good! The rest of the food came almost 30 minutes later, but it was hot and delicious. The salmon had seared skin at the bottom which was to die for. The portion sizes are reasonable, but if you're extremely hungry I would recommend getting some sushi rolls as well. 

Overall, I enjoyed my food and I will return!
author: Ayushi A.

description: I don't like eating in the city. Mostly you don't really get good service, quality and the taste of the food is not the best and you pay lot of money. Ginza confirmed my thesis one more time. I wouldn't run away from Ginza but it wouldn't be my choice to go again. I'd rather go to whole foods salad bar at the end of the street. Rolls are on the pricey side, they are ok, not good, not delicious... Lychee iced tea is so sweet, too much sugar. Get one and add water to split in two.
author: Taner Y.

description:
It's hard to find good restaurants in this neighborhood (let alone sushi), so this was a nice surprise. The service is slow and aloof, but other than that, we had a good experience. 

We had: 
Ginza (no aioli - in my opinion, mayo should be banned from all sushi restaurants): YUM! Yellowtail was delish, and the seared fish on top gave it a nice, smoky flavor.
Daburu: the hit roll of the evening! The salmon was SO fresh, and the lemon and tobiko on top was really refreshing and gave it a little citrus kick.
Suisei: I'm not generally one for fried sushi, but tonight, I thought what the hell. This one was also delicious; the crab was perfect, and the outer fried layer was light and tasty.
Uni Nigiri: OMG. It was from Japan (Hokkaido), and was absolute perfection. Very glad I saved this for last, because it was the best possible way to finish the meal.
 
Along with the rolls, we had the garlic scallop bowl - YUM, and my bf had the monkfish liver. He almost sent it back because it didn't taste fresh, but since I didn't try it, I can't give my two cents. We also ordered two beers, and our total bill was around $90. Not bad for what we had in this bank-breaking, God-forsaken town!
author: Jessica C.

description:
Over priced sushi
And the pickup wait time is disgusting 

I was told to pick up 4 rolls in 15min I been here waiting for over 30 min. 

It's not that hard to be honest to make 4 rolls when it isn't busy at all.
author: Faris O.

description:
What a comedy of errors that was.  Came in for a friend's birthday as a group of 5 because the wait at Cha Cha Cha was an hour.  Menu sounded great, pictures looked good on yelp, we're always up for creative sushi like we don't get down in the 'burbs, but...

* We probably waited 20 minutes between each bit of food being dropped off at our table
* When you are sharing among five people, this means each plate gives you one bite of carpaccio or one piece of sushi, which is not a lot of food
* We were all already starving when we sat down and this was only exacerbated by the slow pace
* They were out of several things (the tartare, the Kyoto roll, and the kicker was we ordered 2 of the negitoro nigiri special and about an hour into the meal, someone dropped off one 2-piece order and said "sorry, that's the last one") 
* Water was not refilled; eventually our friend got fed up and grabbed the water pitcher himself...which only had enough water in it for 2 glasses 
* We left still hungry.  Can't remember the last time I've had that happen.  

I should say that the food, when bits of it showed up, was actually pretty good, and we would have ordered more of it, but after spending 2 hours eating tiny morsels every 20 minutes we were not in the mood to wait another 40.  Instead we decided to hit the Whole Foods for dessert before they closed at 10.  

The servers were nice, but no one checked in with us about the pace -- I don't know if this is just how it is here or what.
author: Michaela L.

description:
I am always afraid of going out to eat sushi with a group because I am afraid everyone is going to want to "try" my sushi and leave me with none. or if we share rolls- I won't get enough. #fatgirlworries 

We came here as a group and each of us got our own rolls and I exchanged some of mine for some of theirs- so I didn't feel jipped! 
Also- I got a free lychee tea with my checkin! And I love me anything free! #cheap4life
author: Julianna I.

description:
Ginza is a nice little spot to enjoy Japanese food. The restaurant is clean and spacious and the staff are very welcoming. I had a chicken karage salad and the uni nigiri and the negitoro nigiri.

The salad was great. They served up a very generous portion of salad with delicious and crunchy chicken karage on the side. It was a filling and satisfying choice for $9. The chicken was a little dry but I did enjoy the crunchy texture.

I was disappointed by the nigiri especially given how pricey it was. The sushi rice quality was peer t terrible and the rice to fish ratio was totally off. I hate to be one of those picky people but if I'm paying $12 for two nigiri I kind of expect some quality.

The negitoro was awful it just tasted bland. And I would not recommend that anyone get this. The uni special was a real shame because the uni from Japan and Santa Barbara was quite fresh and sweet. However it was underchilled and once again the nigiri itself - soggy seaweed and poor sushi rice really ruined the experience for me.

Overall I would definitely recommend Ginza as a place for lunch but I would say real sushi snobs can give this place a miss.
author: Sarah T.

description:
My cousin, boyfriend and I came stumbling on in here around 8:30 on a Sunday and were seated promptly! The staff was friendly and inviting. The ambiance was very nice and Japanese-eu. There's a mural of apocalyptic, abstract-esque samurais on the wall which I thought added a nice touch. Also, the bar area was eye-pleasing with their wine collection. 
We got hot tea with our meal and it was nicely served with a tea strainer in each individual glass cup! Very nice touch! We used the Yelp check in for a free iced lychee tea, and it tasted like it was made with REAL lychees! So cool! At milk tea shops, I've only ever encountered lychee syrups, so this was definitely a nice twist. I definitely prefer this real, refreshing lychee taste now. Uguu~ 
Ordered the tartare appetizer which was bomb dot com. Compared to other restaurants, this place actually gives a generous amount of tartare with a deliciously, crunchy side of chips! MmMMm. Then, we ordered three rolls. I forgot what all the names of the rolls were, but the one with scallops on it were mMmM mMmmM gooood. I was surprised though that the rolls were smaller than the general rolls I see at other sushi roll restaurants. Regardless, however, I did enjoy each and every one of them. And I didn't leave the restaurant with a massive, painful food coma. 
Thanks again Ginza~ Hope to stop by here again soon!
author: Kim N.

description: Ginza was an amazing restaurant. I came here with high expectations from the yelp review and I actually left getting better food and service than I was even expecting. The waitress was a jewel, very professional. The rolls I had were just fresh, large, and flavorful. I couldn't believe how fresh and delicious the fish was. My biggest surprise was the squid legs which were plump, juicy, and lightly crispy; forget the overly fried calamari you find at restaurants, this was the real deal. Listen, just come try this place if you're craving Japanese food and you're in the area. Your friends and you yourself will be thankful.
author: Chris O.

description: My go-to. Great fresh fish, daily specials, and no wait. Unlike most spots, their specialty rolls aren't filled with weird western interpretations and the nigiri and sashimi are quality to standalone. Not the cheapest but it shows in the quality!
author: Elain S.

description: Meh, ordered takeout and was not that impressed with freshness. I'd say it's overpriced for what it is. I ordered two rolls, rainbow and ginza. Ginza was not bad, rainbow roll - nah, the deep fried stuff and the shrimp on it did not taste fresh.
author: Olga A.

description:
I came here with a couple friends for a reunion. We didn't bother looking at the menu beforehand as we noticed that this place had 4.5 stars. 4.5 stars? It had to be good. When we sat down there wasn't much to the menu. Most dishes ranged from $10-$20/dish and portions being on the smaller side. Three of us arrived on time and used the yelp check in for a free litchi ice tea. When the fourth one finally came 30min later, there was no more yelp check in offer. We weren't sure if the restaurant took down the free check in because we had already redeemed three freebies or if there was a glitch on yelp. The litchi iced tea was very delicious.

The Daburu roll ($11) was delicious. I am a sucker for anything with fresh salmon and lemon. It was a light and refreshing roll. The Kaiyo roll ($14) was also very good. The fried potato chips garnished on top of the roll was a very interesting addition to the roll. With only 8 small pieces per roll, shared amongst two people, we weren't full. 

I tasted the tofu steak my friend ordered and it was really good. It came with three pieces of small tofu, asparagus, tomatoes, and a bowl of rice. There wasn't much of it. 

Quality of the food was excellent, but the portions resemble Japanese portions more than American portions. Do not come here if you are hungry and plan to get full without spending $$$. My friend, after ordering a sushi roll (which came with 5 pieces) and steak appetizer, wanted to go to Chipotle after his meal.

The one star taken off was mainly for the slow service. There was one server taking care of ALL the tables on the floor. There was maybe ~40 people on the floor and all the tables were filled. It was very difficult to get his attention to fill up our tea cups and get a fork. Maybe it was because of the holiday season that they were understaffed.
author: Amy T.

description: Fresh fish here. The chef special had a variety of seafood. Kind of pricey, portions were okay, but I guess you pay for the quality here.
author: Chan S.

description: I'm very picky when it comes to sushi, and I highly recommend this place if you are looking for sushi in SF for a reasonable price
author: Dilip K.

description:
If I remember correctly, they have little signs on the tables that say if you give them a review, they'll give you a free dessert.  I'm sure no one wants to hold up their phone and say, "Hey I gave you a terrible review on Yelp so please give me free dessert."  With that being said I don't think this place deserves the 4.5 stars it currently has.  

The food is just fine, but not amazing.  There are dozens of better sushi options in the city, but the prices here are decent.  Got the salmon teriyaki once, that was a mistake.  

The servers seem a little too eager to please and they're so polite that I can't seem to have a natural interaction with any of them. Maybe because every time I have been here I've been sitting with 1 of the only people dining, but they just stand against the far wall and stare until someone eating would need something. It makes me uncomfortable, but I do appreciate their desire to be helpful when needed... just wish it was less awkward.
author: Jessica F.

description: I ordered their Chirashi bowl through Caviar. It was delicious, and all the fish tasted very fresh!
author: Mary T.

description:
At times I think I am the zoning manager. By that I mean I don't go to certain neighborhood for fear of the (un)pleasantries of running into people I don't want to run into. And once that the decision is made I try to find my way around the food that I like but appear to be from that neighborhood. I try to venture out so to speak. Ginza is of a good location to me as the neighborhood will most likely never attract anyone I know. That said, the geo desirability is not all that I like about the restaurant. It offered a Yelp check in special. Then the lunch is such a bargain. Finally the food is extremely good. Absolutely you must try to the rib eye steak donburi. The sushi combo is good but I think I'd like to try the uni sampler next. Beer is refreshing. You can definitely do sake bomb here.

Best time to come is weekend mid to late afternoon before the lunch special ends at 4.

In fact I got your afternoon journey all mapped out. Eat here. Shop. Then go to Club Deluxe for jazz and cocktails. Just make sure you don't run into me. I don't like to be found.
author: Victoria E.

description: I got the dragon roll after reading all the reviews and was pleasently delighted by the flavor and texture. I also had the green tea which came in an amazing mug(picture below). All in all it was amazing except for the fact that I was quite expensive for everything that I bought.
author: Oona O.

description:
Clean interior and cool paintings inside the restaurant. Looked very clean and appealing. The service was good too. My bf and I ordered the ginza, akairo, kaiyo, and the daburu roll. 

All of the rolls were interesting. Each unique but there was no roll that I absolutely loved. Just mediocre to me. Maybe it's because I prefer the classic rolls. The presentation was nice though. What I did enjoy was the free lychee tea that we got when we checked in!
author: Annie H.

description:
The only sushi place on Haight street! Okay, now I want to take a moment to write about my experience dining at Ginza Sushi & Sake tonight and my opinion about the food quality.

The place is clean and spacious. I got seated at around 6:30pm on a memorial holiday, noticing there was no need to make reservation prior to arrival. My boyfriend and I ordered 11 dishes in total. They were: butter scallop (comes with white miso soup), seaweed salad, beef tataki, and 8 other nigiri which I will put caption on my photos. Overall, the food was mediocre, but indeed there were several dishes the highlight of the entire meal that I strongly recommend you to try-seared halibut topped with Ikura nigiri, and the butter scallop as an entree. They are both nicely flavored and will definitely give your tongue a kick.

One thing I must say is that the service needs to be improved. There were occasions that the service is so bad that it irritated me. I have to mention things more than twice to a waitress, or they would forget it. They even forgot to bring me the soup that comes with the scallop until I literally requested for it... 

Well. If you live near the place, you could try their sushi, but it does not worth to drive for a long distance to this place :)
author: Annabelle L.

description:
Roomy and nice sushi bar. Good food for good price. Very quick seating too. 
#ginzasf
author: Henry G.

description:
Wanted to check out their Happy Hour after work and was actually disappointed in this place.  With all the great reviews, I thought this was going to be my new go-to Japanese restaurant.  

First let me start by saying that we went during Happy Hour, but they purposely did not show us the Happy Hour menu until we asked for it.  We ordered the California rolls and Agedashi Tofu from their happy hour menu for $5 each.  When it came out, there were 6 small/medium sized pieces of sushi and 3 small pieces of Agedashi tofu.  Since this was my first time eating here, I'm not sure if they made the portions smaller for Happy Hour or if this is their normal size, but it was not worth the price with plenty of comparable restaurants nearby.      

Their entrees were average.  For the price, you can get a lot better of a deal in Japan town.  A pet peeve of mine is when restaurants show gratuity calculations on the bottom of the receipt calculated "After Taxes" without telling you that.  This was the case with Ginza and I find this to be pretty deceptive and a lot of people probably wouldn't catch this.
author: Justin Y.

description:
The Poke Salad and Sankura were both great. The Sankura was tasty and has a slightly spicy after taste and the salad also good. The portions were a bit small so be prepared to order a maybe two plates or a second one to share. The lychee ice tea was really good and refreshing.

We came here during the 3rd finals game and were still able to get a table which was convenient. A solid place to come for a last minute lunch or dinner.
author: Francisco D.

description: I really love paying a lot for sushi if it is good and this is good. I really love when the chefs take their time with the meal. I prefer to wait twenty to thirty minutes for a roll if it is good. They take their time, but it is worth it. Try not to be in a rush. The staff prefers if you sit with the menu for a long time so you can make the right decision on your meal. Maybe have some tea and a scone a few blocks down before hand so you can relax and not be in a rush.
author: Sam B.

description: Only done delivery from here a few times so take that into account. Sushi is very middle of the road. Creations are fairly inventive but for the price, it's pretty mediocre.  And for whatever reason, only once out of three times have they figured out to read the directions to keep the fish sushi separate from the vegetarian sushi. So attention to detail is not their strong suit.  I don't think we will order from here again, it's been too off the mark each time for the price you pay.
author: Saminda W.

description:
The customer service here is what gives this place a one star. The chefs are constantly working hard- food was great and prices are reasonable. 1st of all - don't bother making a reservation, they tried sitting us at a table that was nested right up against the host stand 1 inch from the table next to it.

Then we received attitude when we wanted to sit closer to the back (even after making a reservation for a table there). The waiter threw the menus down and walked to the back when we pointed out there was a table that was open. 2nd of all, seconds after being seated, the waitress wanted our order and kept saying "that's it?" every time. To wrap up the night, when the check came, before I could even sign my name...the waitress was waiting beside me for the receipt (I realized it was 9:50pm and they were cleaning up to close). People were sweeping and banging dishes around... She also opened it to check the tip on the way to the back. 

All in all, save your tip to give to the chefs here. They're the real MVPs
author: Nico M.

description:
I cannot stop coming here. It is a favorite for dinner, coming multiple times a week.

The oysters are amazing, as well as everything else I have tried! You are always greeted with a big smile and welcome, and leave the same way. 

It is SO hard to find good food on Haight, and this place will not let you down.

The service is one of my favorite parts about Ginza. They have, by far, the best service on Haight Street- period. I have been to every restaurant on this street to Cole Valley. I really do love the staff, they will see me many, many times to come. 

Bonus* the space well kept, clean, and the music is always hella chill. #VIBES
author: Nika C.

description: Great sushi and presentation of food. It's a bit on the pricey side, but well worth it. Clean restaurant and friendly staff too.
author: Kristin D.

description:
I wish they had a broader veggie roll selection, but hey, plus ten points for being a solid enough sushi delivery joint. My husband felt the same about his sushi (fish) rolls. 

My search for an epic sushi spot continues ....
author: Gabriela W.

description:
Sushi Akairo roll, rib-eye Oroshi among other dishes  were great! The miso was great too. I really like the ambience. Very close to Golden Gate Park. Modern decor with interesting art. Also don't leave without trying the matcha creme brûlée!!! 

Nice place, friendly staff and very good food!
author: Ron E.

description:
Firecracker salmon was bomb! 

Great service
loved the chalkboard menu
The tofu steak was the perfect portion and very flavorful!
author: Rachel D.

description:
I ran into Ginza Sushi with my friend and we feel really grateful. We were looking for great sushis and this is exactly what we got. We had the cucumber; avocado; spicy tuna and Philadelphia roll. It was super tasty and I appreciate the fact that you don't have to wait for too long. 
Thanks!
author: Solene -.

description: Meh. Not very good. Hamachi wasn't very fresh and tasted fishy. My mouth felt gross after eating it. Roll was only okay... nothing special and very bland. Also it's weird that the 2pc sashimi is $14 and the 2pc nigiri is 6????????? How odd
author: Kasey R.

description:
I came here for a late lunch with a group of 4. We ordered a whole bunch of rolls to share: Ginza Roll, Jiyugaoka Roll (a vegetable roll), and three roll combo lunches (two with dragon roll and the third with a rainbow roll.) 

The roll combo lunch is a good deal, and is offered from 12-4 pm. For ONLY $11.95, you receive a miso soup, 4 pc California roll, 4 pc tuna roll, and a choice of dragon roll, rainbow roll, or chef selection roll. Other rolls outside of the lunch special are standard sushi prices. 

The sushi pieces here are very, very small and nothing special. The rice in the sushi is hard, and the roll is barely filled with anything. We spent more than $80 for the four of us to be barely full for lunch. In addition, they charge for tea here, when usually Japanese restaurants serve tea on the house. 

We expected better sushi considering the Yelp reviews, but we were all disappointed.
author: Christine L.

description: Such a great place for people to come and eat. The sushi rolls are amazing and the sake is great. Good for Sunday dinner.
author: Katherine L.

description:
Muy bueno! Inari sushi didn't last long enough to take a picture. Donda ate almost all of it! 
Service has been above par.
author: Joseph J.

description:
A little more pricey compared to other restaurants in the area, but if you're looking for good sushi in the Haight this is the perfect place for you. 
I haven't tried every single roll this place has to offer, but so far I haven't had one I haven't loved. Great atmosphere, friendly servers, and amazing food make this a place you can't ignore.
author: Fratz F.

description: Since my trip to Japan, it has been a real struggle to find good quality sushi. Ginza has fresh quality sushi. I would come back for the moriwase.
author: Food C.

description:
We've been here 3 times now and it has become one of our favorite Japanese stops in SF. They have a great sushi selection complimented by yummy appetizers. 

Personal favorites are: Suisei, Ginza roll, Akairo, and whatever specials they have on the menu. We look forward to many more visits to our local neighborhood favorite.

Also for you sweet tooth's out there, go for the matcha crembrulee!
author: Bradley C.

description:
"They have various selections of rolls that are all amazing and fresh !"
Of course all fish meant to be eaten raw must be frozen to kill parasites.
author: Park S.

description: A local joint that constantly delivers quality sushi and the nicest team! Welcomed addition to the neighborhood.
author: Julianne N.

description:
Really disappointed with my experience here.
I passed by this place for lunch and decided to try it. There were only 2 others in this restaurant besides me. The one waitress there was busy cleaning tables and took forever to come to me and didn't serve me tea/water after I asked for it; I had to ask several times. She provided me with the menu and I was confused because I had thought there was a lunch menu too. So then I asked her for it, she took away the original menu and gave me the lunch menu instead. Why weren't both presented in the first place? I'm assuming she knowingly did not provide the lunch menu so I can spend more on the regular menu (later I saw her doing this to another family that walked in).

The food itself was mediocre, the service wasn't great despite it being not busy at all, the service was dubious and it was just very unsatisfying all around. 

Would not come back or recommend.
author: M L.

description:
If you really want sit-down sushi in this stretch of the Haight, I think this is your best option. The room is spacious, moodily-lit, and the staff is friendly. 

That said, I don't feel like there's anything particularly exciting about the sushi here and it's pricey. For everyday sushi - I'd rather get grocery store sushi at Gus's down the street (it's surprisingly good!).
author: Ryan D.

description: I think I just found my new sushi spot...GET THE SURF AND TURF!! Like damn, I'm full but I might just get another roll..
author: Zaryn S.

description: Free lychee iced tea with check-in! Actually pretty good. I wanted to order scallops, but they were out. So I ordered the tofu. There were only three pieces, but it was really good. I haven't had tofu as tasty as this before or since! The meal itself was a little bit on the pricier side for tofu and it didn't fill me up. I would still come back though. The sauce on the tofu was delicious and savory. The tofu was the perfect texture. Excellent!
author: Mallory L.

description: Great vibe, even greater atmosphere!! The food tastes great and I would definitely come back again next time I'm in the area!!
author: Christy E.

description:
This is a really nice classy place in the Haight.  The ambience is great and it's a good date night place. The sushi bar is very nice and they have a huge flat screen TV if you're into watching the game. We were able to get seats immediately and it was at about 35% occupancy at 9 PM on a Friday night. 

The drinks are really good and the lycheetini is highly recommended.  I was a little sad that they don't have soft drinks on tap,  as I'm not a huge canned soda guy I know I know...

We ordered the spicy tuna,  the Dabu (salmon)  and the shrimp  tempura. All around pretty good food.  Pretty good sushi for the price.  Our friends got the Tuna main dish and they really enjoyed it. I would say this place isn't bad for the price and the food is decent.  The staff is very nice and overall we enjoyed it.
author: Arman J.

description: Fresh fish. Good with families. Lovely tea. And nice desserts, all reasonably priced. All in the Haight. Easy walking from Golden Gate Park.
author: Jane P.

description: Great selection of rolls & the firecracker salmon is amazing!! The Softshell crab roll is pretty great too.
author: Ruel S.

description: Food was delicious .shirashi bowl come with varity of fresh sashimi , i have order butter gatlic scallop it was amazing and oyster is very fresh  service was excellent very friendly  good atmospher and nice decoration , so easy to find parking spot #ginzasf
author: Nattakarn N.

description:
This is one of the best service I've had at a restaurant in a long time.  Our waitress was really attentive & nice.  We even got a free lychee iced tea for checking in!

For food we ordered the: Ginza, Akairo, Kairo, & Daburu roll... along with an order of hamachi nigiri.  I believe the Ginza was my favorite out of all the specialty rolls.  Each one was really unique, and had an extra item for flare.  But it was exactly these extra ingredients that made me not like the rolls after the first couple pieces.  For example, one had lemon for zest, and another had potato for flavor... They were good at first, but then I had to remove the extra items in order to finish the remaining pieces.  It was just overwhelming for my senses.  

I was actually quite disappointed that none of the specialty rolls had that "wow factor" that would get me back in the door.  Great service aside, I don't see myself coming back for their food any time soon...
author: Eric L.

description:
Went on a Monday afternoon, looking for a sushi place to eat in the area. Not busy, service was quick and appropriate when needed. 
Now let's get down to the nitty gritty; as we all know the dirtiest things in all restaurants are the menus. The menu I had had a large shoyu stain on the first page, just an observation nothing to do with the food, the decor was pleasant and the smell was of an old cloroxed wash cloth, was used to wipe down the tables as many establishments do the smell lingered. 
On to it. The sushi selections were of a nice variety, good mix of different rolls and a nice selection of drinks. We requested a substitute for one of the ingredients on a roll and they were happy to do it for us, very accommodating. 
We ordered Kaiyo, Sakura, and Dragon sub unagi for spicy tuna... the taste was fresh and delightful. 
Aside from some rowdy, inappropriate patrons next to us we enjoyed our meal!
author: Sabrina V.

description: Yummy food, nice servers! We were given free drinks, and the sushi was delicious. I highly recommend!
author: Matt D.

description:
Was craving japanese food around the Inner Sunset / Parnassus Heights area and Yelp brought me here. Located on bustling Haight Street, Ginza doesn't just cater to tourists, but provided one of the better sushi experiences I've had in awhile. 

For starters, we checked into Yelp and Ginza gave us a free Lychee green tea (Lychee fruit and all!) It was SUPER refreshing and tasted almost like lychee juice - couldn't make out the tea so much, but I didn't mind at all. 

Next up, I ordered the Kayoi roll (yellowtail, salmon, thin strips of fried sweet potato and roe on top, spicy tuna in the middle) and the buttered garlic scallop main entrée. 

The roll was one of the tastiest rolls I've had in awhile - fish super fresh, and I loved the attention to detail in the fried sweet potato. That added a super complex flavor profile that was a nice surprise. 

Buttered Garlic Scallop bowl was definitely buttery - a little too buttery. I felt the rice was drenched in garlic butter and the dish itself ended up feeling too heavy. I recommend lightening up on the butter before I would order again. Scallops were cooked well, though. That was definitely the highlight for this dish.

Lastly, we checked in on Facebook and added a picture and for that, got a free housemade dessert! I was honestly expecting matcha ice cream or something, but when the matcha creme brulée came out, I was so pleasantly surprised. It was very very tasty, you could taste the matcha in the creme and all is well with the world. Would recommend Ginza if you're in the area and craving sushi. It did not disappoint.
author: Lauren S.

description: We got the fried squid legs and a soft shell roll.  AMAZING.  It was by far the best fried squid legs I have ever had.  Everything was fresh.  The service is great and the food was delivered to our table fast!  I'm so happy I finally tried this place as it is only three blocks from my house.  I can't wait to come back!!
author: Melissa Y.

description: Ordered an udon soup and a salmon roll. Got the soup right away nice and hot. Sushi roll came an hr later. No bueno.
author: Jos E.

description: We were all feeling sushi and turned to trusty Yelp. We ordered a bunch of rolls (akairo, daburu, salmon skin, rainbow). The daburu rolls was my favorite of the bunch, as I love the combo of soft salmon and lemon. The rolls are elaborately made and have lots of ingredients. My friend's grilled rib eye steak with shiitake mushroom sauce was also excellent. It was flavored well. The prices are reasonable.
author: Heidi H.

description: #ginzasf My first time here. Love the sushi. Especially the toro and the frsh sashimi.  They have really great tasting fresh fish. Would come back again. Left to right: sakura, ginza, akairo.
author: Mara M.

description: First time at Ginza with friends! We walked around Haight and found this place. The environment is pretty relaxed. The sushi was good! Their waiters are nice too! #ginzasf
author: Kharisma E.

description: Came here because of Groupon. Ordered Gonza Special Aburi Engawa Nigiri. Very fresh with little smoke flavor. Love the Sake Kama. Not too oily nor too dry. Chirashi was good too. Definitely will come back.
author: Jane L.

description: Good sushi for a good price! The Kaiju roll was filling and the Akairo was delicious!
author: Marco G.

description: A satisfying dinner w/ friends. Dish portions are reasonably filling;) Love the seaweed salad with a bit hint of lemon juice in it. Makes it fresh.
author: Leona W.

description: Great food! Sushi rolls Bara and Dragon were awesome. They were nice and friendly and the lyecee tea was fantastic!
author: Lexi N.

description: Excellent food and service. Sushi rolls were some of the best I've had in San Francisco.
author: Josh P.

description: Awesome service and food. Very interesting drinking and food. The waitress and waiter was very nice and communicate well.
author: Mike L.

description: I got "Salmon Miso Cream Sauce" for lunch. It was really amazing. Good taste and good quality. Great location and great service. Will be back for another crack.
author: Torie M.

description:
The sushi is very good. 
The atmosphere is nice.
The waitress was cool.
The edamame & garlic scallops were delicious
author: Sheyla P.

description: Always enjoy coming here for sushi! Their vegetarian rolls are amazing and the Ginza mule is to die for. A great place for friends, a date or family. Definitely recommend!
author: Dustin S.

description: Great spot for sushi. My only issue was the never ending progressive house music playing in the background (which, really, shouldn't be an issue. Lol). The overall atmosphere of the interior was nice- wish they had more bar spots. There's only about ~4 seats at the bar. Get their Kazar roll!
author: Majid A.

description: Oh my - where do I begin?! The tender juiciness of the Karage? The fresh slurp-able oysters? The sweet refreshing lychee tea? All favorites especially during happy hour!
author: Jonathan C.

description:
We're here on Thursday around 5.30pm. Love the Miyaki oysters, Ankimo, Dynabite, Sake kama, and Engawa nigiri. They're fresh & delicious. The waitress recommended us Garlic edamame, Kaiju roll, and Akairo roll which are great too. Unfortunately they ran out of Uni, my fav. 

5 stars for menu options, great service(very attentive), good size of roll(not too much rice, bite size), good ambient inside the restaurant, and reasonable price. 

I'll definitely come back to try other dishes with my friends again.
author: Kei S.

description:
I really like that this local spot opened up this year. After a year of it being a mediocre indian restaurant - i was sad that the space was being wasted (it used to be Kan Zaman, where I had and fell in love with my first mulled wine). They did a nice job with the interior - and they even have a giant TV which somehow isn't cheesy and distracting. I appreciate checking on the warriors game during dinner :)

On the menu the, Suisei roll was the winner. I've had mixed experiences with the roll that has sliced jalapeños on top. Was lacking flavor this time, last time it was great.

For where I live, it's really a toss up between this spot and Sushi Bistro. I'm going to say that Sushi Bistro has the edge in variety of rolls, which also gives them an edge in quality. Ambiance I would give to Ginza as well as proximity (to me).

Bottom line is that they have quality sushi here. No need to be sketched out because of the location.
author: Ross H.

description: Really good sushi for what you might expect in this area. The Sakura roll and seaweed salad were great! And the place has a pretty cool vibe.
author: Aylee N.

description: Convenient time for some quick sushi bites, open from 12PM-10PM. My brother and I wanted to give this place a shot while shopping in Haight. Parking was not difficult to find this time. We sat at the sushi bar and received excellent customer service. The sushi was ON POINT. We have. I complaints what so ever. Whenever I come back to visit SF, I'm definitely making this a stop. Come by! You won't regret it.
author: Kat M.

description:
Trendy little spot. 

With military discipline, your Chefs sent food to table; that 1000-yard-stare of tried veterans that have received Purple Hearts for heroism in the face of overwhelming Saturday Night Rush Hour Shit Storm. 

Food was good, albeit predicable. With so many edible options in San Fransisco doing amazing food, you served Safe flavors. The boldest flavors were the smells of weed wafting in from the open door. 

I would remind you that a restaurant is about experience--not only about food, but also atmosphere. Food is the centerpiece for good company and conversation. 

Your restaurant was ungodly loud. I was entirely unable to hold a conversation, only a foot away from my wife. 

For some of you, that might sound like a blessing but I happen to like my wife. 

Food isn't bad, but is it worth braving San Fran traffic and junkies screaming THE LAND OF RAPE AND HONEY on a bullhorn
(True fucking story) to get there when sushi is stacked 4 deep on a block. 

That's for you to decide.
author: Grisamentum A.

description:
Me and gf've been to many different sushi place but so far this is our top list .
The fish is really fresh, we was order large moriwasa which is chef choice sushi & sashimi,and it was amazing
Another dish that we had "salmon miso cream sauce" It was simply good and was surprise by the texture and the taste.
All in all, Ginza is great ,food was pretty solid  fish is fresh.We would definitely return again.
author: Pasakorn V.

description: If only I could give a negative star rating. My boyfriend and I tried to go here for dinner tonight with my service dog (who I have for a seizure disorder). Upon the waitress saying "no dogs here" in such poor english, I explained to her it was a service animal. She looked unsure and said "okay hold on". Her coworker / manager I'm assuming comes over and asks for proof of paperwork. While I am always more than compliant to show this, it is actually illegal to ask for it. After showing my paperwork and still having an unure reaction, we decided to leave. Clearly a staff/ management of unintelligent human beings who don't understand the way the world works outside of their cultural bubble. Unfortunate that a place with seemingly decent food has such a horrible and inconsiderate group of people as their staff. Maybe they can get their shit together or continue to be a sad excuse of a functioning establishment. Cheers, to the management who will probably read this and not understand what I am saying
author: Lauren F.

description: Salmon sashimi - the best I've ever had recently! California roll is pretty good also. Perfect place for a healthy lunch
author: Marina M.

description: This place is great food great service and good prices all things considered. Highly recommend.
author: C. Marie W.

description: Delicious food in this vibrating atmosphere. Friendly service and great playlist, the songs here makes the place cozy and modern!
author: Yuri S.

description: Everything was so yummy! Best edamame I've tried. Awesome selection of sushi, presentation, & taste!
author: Michaela P.

description: Awesome place for great specialty rolls and sashmi!  I'll definitely come back for more!
author: Sasa C.

description: Awesome, inventive sushi place with friendly service. Highly recommend. Try the Ginza roll! It's excellent.
author: Will M.

description: Came here a second time with my friends and I thought it was just as great as the last time I was here!  I ordered a sushi roll that had crab tempura & crab meat.  We also tried their garlic butter scallops & let me me tell you, you can't go wrong!  The edamame was also delicious!  Highly recommend coming here if you want sushi in the Haight area
author: Mikayla M.

description: "Horrendo".  I'm Japanese, have lived in Tokyo, and lower my standards for Japanese food by 50% at all but the finest establishments.  But the food here (Caviar delivered), is soooo off, it's beyond description.  Not fresh, odd ingredients (that are not surprisingly good), etc. etc.  Prison-worthy only.
author: Rex I.

description:
Pretty good, not great. I did like the negitoro special (2 pieces) and the miso soup! Good quality nori. But the dragon roll was not particularly inspiring. So, good--but not great. My colleague felt similarly about the taste of her rolls. 

The interior is attractive, spacious, and clean. The staff is friendly and polite. However, it seemed like they forgot about my colleague's second roll since it came a little late in the game and it was not busy. The servers don't check up on you constantly, which I like. Liked my service here overall. 

Would I come back? Probably not. It's decent, but I would rather not spend my lunch break on just "decent". I'm not warning you away--I did enjoy my negitoro and miso soup--but I personally would not come back.
author: Jasmine G.

description: Delicious sushi and sashimi!!!!  Yummy Yummy!  Great date night place right in the Haight!!!
author: Adam L.

description:
This place has close to the worst service I've ever experienced, at least the one time I went. Our waitress seemed to try to play it off by pretending she didn't speak English and acting like some sort of a coy geisha, walking by our table very quickly and sort of nodding in our direction but ignoring us.

There were several parts that were disappointing. It started with a table of six people who came in at least ten minutes after us getting their edamame before us. (There were two of us.)

It continued with silence from our server not having any sort of update about what the hell was going on. I can understand screwing something up, not putting our order in, something like that. People make mistakes. Purposefully ignoring us and not resetting our expectations was a bigger problem.

At some point, when we still don't have food, I notice we also don't have soy sauce. I asked that she bring us soy sauce for when our sushi came out. She did her coy little nodding bullshit.

After 50 minutes of waiting, no edamame, no water refills. Guess what? Our sushi comes out, and no soy sauce.

We got up and left.
author: adrian b.

description: So nice to finally have quality sushi that tasted fresh. Ordered about 3 rolls with tea and sake it all was great! Good service as well. The window seats were fun to watch out of. The seats were too high though they need to be a little lower for the height of the counter.
author: Beatrice J.

description: My family came here on vacation. It was so good! Food came out really fast, the staff was amazing and the prices were fair. I got the kyoto roll and loved it. The miso soup was about the same as most places but the gyoza was a little different- in the best way.
author: Ella S.

description:
It's good place to have sushi .. the portions were decent, and sushi has good flavor.
I didn't like that sushi rolls were too cold. It was bit offsetting but can be discarded.
Good sushi, and will try it again
author: Ruby B.

description: Love love love Ginza sushi. I've been coming here as a regular for the last year and am obsessed with the lychee iced tea and the yam tempura roll with the mango on top. It can get a bit pricey and I wish their selection on the yelp delivery app included all of their sushi but oh well.
author: Mira B.

description: This is probably one of my favorite sushi spots to go to in sf super late key and relaxing the food and desert is delicious!!
author: Vincent B.

description:
This is one of the best Japanese restaurants in SF.
I came there to eat sushi roll.
It was good, especially KAZAN.
If you come near, you should try them!!
author: Mayu M.

description: Very nice ambience away from the mess and crowds on Haight st. Came here and got a table for 2 without any waiting time on a Saturday night. Great service and food. I especially like a sushi chef if he/she pays attention to the details of plates (ice cubes under sashimi in every small bowl!). Definitely will come back to try more.
author: Victoria F.

description: Yummy!! I've found the best sushi restaurant in San Francisco. 5 star service and the food is excellent !!
author: Eren R.

description:
Came across this place while shopping for shoes on Haight st, and man this place is LIT. I mean, who would expect such a legit japanese spot on Haight st.

I ordered some number of dishes, and Garlic Butter Scallop rice and Chirashi stand out the most.

Staff is very attentive and friendly (also a real cutie)

Would definitely come back. Highly Recommended.
author: Nelson L.

description: The rainbow salad was amazing! Perfectly spicy and savory!  Service was good. There were lots of sushi and sashimi options for fish I hadn't ever had like ocean trout- was amazing also!!
author: Jennifer D.

description: This is a great sushi place in the Haight. Came here for sushi after a fishing trip and had a great time. We started off with the same Kama which was broiled to perfection and very tender. It came with a great ponzu sauce. Then, we got the Chirashi bowl and the tofu steak. The fish in the chirashi was very fresh and the tofu steak was silken soft. The lycee iced tea was the most delicious thing I have ever put in my mouth. The Kazan roll was also delicious. Great service too. Would recommend!
author: Cathy C.

description: Came in for a light lunch with sashimi in mind and ended up splitting the tuna&salmon tartare, rainbow poke salad, and Japan uni. Everything was incredibly fresh and presented beautifully. Perfect for what I was craving!
author: Anna Z.

description:
This is a great spot to come with a group! I made reservations (you can call or email) a few days ahead of time, but I didn't see any walk-ins having to wait long for tables. What we looooooooved: Ginza Roll, Kaiyo Roll, Kaiju, Sakura Roll, Suisei Roll. 

I noticed that the rolls didn't have much rice in them, which was actually really great because the flavors of the fish stood out so much more. The fried crab was cooked perfectly - crunchy but not dry inside.

The service was quick and our waitress did a great job of recommending rolls for us and making sure we were happy. The drinks are a bit pricey- they have a few sake mixed drinks, as well as japanese beer, wine options and an extensive sake list (I came on a Saturday so I'm not sure if they have any happy hour deals on week days).
author: Rachel K.

description: Wonderful dinner at Ginza. Please try the Firecracker Salmon roll! It's is warm and filling. Would definitely return for a weekday dinner.
author: Eric J.

description: This is good quality reliable sushi. If you need a fix and you're not looking for basic or super fancy at a good price Ginza totally fits the bill. Their signature roll is really tasty and the service is generally pretty good.
author: Paul W.

description:
this restaurant gives u and desert if u write a nice review and show them so I take the other posts with a grain of salt.

The place was fine, but the food was terrible. The rolls didn't have very much fish in them and very little flavor. It just tasted terrible. 

The service wasn't great either.

The place is pretty cheap and tastes pretty cheap.
author: Dan K.

description:
bad experience.could have picked any other place and picked this place for a change, and cos of the attractive happy hour board. 
Interestingly, the happy hour timing is variable and at the discretion of the random supervisor at the place. When asked if I wanted a second round, I questioned the falsified display board in front of the restaurant and agreed for a second round if he would honor his ad in front of the restaurant n he sent the check instead through a day different waiter. 
Terrible treatment. No respect n honor, the happy hour ends at 5:50 pm. Just take a look at the pic. Zoom in on the bill timing. Happy hour into on the bill and the board
author: V J.

description:
Cool vibe, friendly staff. Sushi was small, not very filling. Decent prices (meaning not crazy expensive, but not cheap), however, not worth the size the rolls were. 

Also, they weren't anything crazy tasty. With all the sushi restaurants around, I would rather go somewhere else for tastier sushi even if that meant less of a decor.
author: Kelly G.

description: I love this place! Such good sushi! I would recommend the chef's choice sashimi! We also had the rolls. Let the fun times roll ;) lol.
author: Max B.

description: The Poki Rainbow salad was AWESOME! Just the right amount of spice! I'll be back again!
author: Andye D.

description: The best Teriyaki chicken we've ever had. We randomly stopped in for dinner and it did not disappoint! Wow!
author: Dimitri C.

description: So glad we found this gem near home! Stumbled upon this place after work and really enjoyed dinner. Had the chicken karage, along with the udon and spicy salmon special. Highly recommend!
author: Sarah C.

description: Had a great time at Ginza. I had the Iwashi, Rib-Eye Oroshi, and Anikimo Pate. Be adventurous and try this place out! #WuAdventure
author: Lisa W.

description: They serve good Soporo's. They spicy tuna roll was questionable. The tuna inside was bad tasting and lingered in my mouth for a while.
author: Lauren K.

description: Amazing sushi ! Very great yum yum delicious ! I will come back again tomorrow and eat more sushi and eat more and more and more ! Oh yeah and u get free ice cream and ice tea !!!! Yeah oh yeah so great I love it so much ! Me love this sushi combo plate yeah yeah yummy !!!!
author: Johnny R.

description:
Ginza Sushi & Sake is one of the most disappointing Japanese restaurants I've been to in San Francisco. 

At first glance, the price look to be reasonable (hence the $$ sign by on its yelp page) However, miso soups are $3 a bowl!!! Furthermore, although the chirarshi bowl is $17, Ginza only gives you two thin pieces of salmon/tuna/mackerel/yellowfish and one shrimp. That chirarshi bowl was one of the most skimpy bowls I've had! 

The food is lackluster and the portions are tiny.  I have no idea why this place has the rating it does. Until the prices reflect the portions and the quality of the food here, I'm not coming back to Ginza Sushi & Sake. 

OVERALL: Way over priced for mediocre sushi served in ridiculously small portions. Don't come here unless you enjoy paying $3 for a bowl of miso soup.
author: Nicole J.

description: I ordered food for my friends to celebrate my last day at work. They all loved it. Thank you, Ginza Sushi & Sake. Everything was awesome! Thank you Ming you were very helpful!
author: Cristina B.

description: The tori ginger chicken was awesome.  The salmon miso cream Yaki was melt in your mouth delicious. Also child friendly. Fabulous Japanese food.
author: Loc T.

description: Nice sushi spot tucked towards the end of Haight St. The prices are decent for what you get. The fish is pretty fresh, but the portions could be a bit better--the fish is a bit thin when it comes to the rolls. The alcoholic drinks are nice and compliment the menu items well. The service can be different depending on who is working. The space is also a little dark.
author: Alison M.

description: My second time here within a month and the food still great. Uni is in good quality even though its a local one. Fire Cracker Salmon is not too spicy and flavorful. I would definitely come back for a third time.
author: Belle R.

description:
Japanese restaurant on trendy Haight Street w/ an unassuming exterior and dark lit interior.

Pricing is moderate. 3 items totaled $70. We both enjoyed the Ginza roll while agreeing that the scallops were beyond dry, chewy and overdone. The sauce itself was yummy but the protein ruined the dish. Their omakase wasn't pricey and the fish was fresh. They were out of Uni on a Friday night around 6PM.

Tea isn't free at $3/cup.
author: Julie L.

description: Ordered takeout from here for the first time. The sushi rolls are great! The nigiri is perfect, the fish slices they give you are thick and the fish tastes great! This is definitely my family's new sushi place in the city.
author: Secira N.

description: Best sushi with vegetarian options on all of Haight street! I love there presentation along with niece touches that add flavor and color to the food. Also very reasonable prices. Places like this are hard to come by in the Upper Haight. If you are looking for healthy and fresh sushi come to Gonzalez.
author: Scott Z.

description:
Food was just okay for us. 
- We tried the Tori Ginger Chicken "bento box" ($11) (although this "set" was not actually served in a bento box), which was quite delicious. Tender chicken in a flavorful ginger soy sauce on top of 2 pieces of asparagus. This came with a bowl of rice and miso soup and I wish they would serve a little salad of some sort along with it. All in all, I recommend this dish!
- Sushi bento set ($18) came with 4pc nigiri, 6pc sashimi, 4pc of spicy tuna roll, 4pc of CA roll, vegetable tempura, and salad or soup. Nigiris; a little smaller than I'm used to. Sashimi; thin, generally fresh and okay (a few fishy ones though). The rolls; pretty standard. Vegetable tempura; also smaller than I'm used to, but the crispy batter was good.
- Daburu roll ($10.95) had salmon & cucumber topped with salmon & sliced lemon with yuzu tobiko. Just an okay roll for me... the salmon was a bit colder than we would have liked - made eating the roll slightly uncomfortable. 

Overall, I felt everything was just... miniaturized! Although maybe they are huge on presentation and what not, but for the price, I feel I can have a more fresh and tastier (not to mention bigger) meal elsewhere. Service was amazing though - no complaints there, as they were very friendly from the moment we walked in. There is a bathroom key attached to a gigantic spoon hung on a little good-fortune-cat on the counter across the bathroom door, so don't stand there waiting for someone to walk out of the locked door like how I did!! =P
author: Kris C.

description: We came in during a heat wave where it was 95 out, thinking sushi would be a (cold) good choice. The restaurant itself was hot, but that was fine - so was everywhere around. But in a heat wave like that in 95 degree weather, we shouldn't have to ask for water three times and wait for 15 minutes just for two glasses of water. We were one of only 5-6 seated groups in the half empty restaurant. We ordered sushi - a roll and sashimi - all served warm. The fish and rice should have been kept cold, but no the fish itself was warm and discolored. Also way overprice, with two rolls and two orders of sashimi and two alcoholic drinks, the bill was ~$75 for a bad lunch. We left most of the warm sushi uneaten feeling it wasn't even good to eat. Won't return.
author: Sandy G.

description:
I was skeptical about Ginza at first (sushi in the Haight, really?) but went there with a couple of friends after working out down the street. It was a pretty slow weekday night so service was friendly and accommodating. 

My friends and I tried the chirashi and a few rolls and we were all pleasantly surprised at how fresh the sashimi was in our chirashi. As much as I love chirashi, some mediocre sushi places tend to skimp on fresh fish and quantity in chirashi bowls, but not so at Ginza. It was chock full of really fresh sake, ebi, hamachi, maguro, tamago, and more. The rolls that we shared weren't particularly memorable or special, but tasty nonetheless. 

Maybe my expectations were really low, but I would definitely go back to Ginza. If you're in the area and don't want to go to the Inner Sunset for decent sushi, I would definitely recommend Ginza for a casual option. 

Price: 20-40 range for rolls/chirashi/nigiri
author: Kate M.

description: great dinner tonight with chirashi and ginza roll, very fresh and delicious. the staff was also very friendly. like that it is not too noisy here
author: Mary D.

description: Came here with a party of four for dinner Sunday night. The service here is very attentive - one of us had an allergy and they made sure the plates were served separately. They also have cool tea cups! Super fresh fish - would recommend!
author: Catherine N.

description: Great ambiance, fresh seafood, great service and price! Lisa is amazing! Very clean restaurant with great location along Haight street.
author: Germaine K.

description:
I appreciate the continuous service during the day so we could have an early dinner. The service is prompt and attentive. 

Tori ginger chicken - this is a wonderful, modern update to teriyaki chicken. The grilled vegetables are a perfect accompaniment. 

The special rolls in the below photos were both interesting and tasty without too much sauce. 

The chirashi bowl is generous and fresh with gorgeous presentation.
author: Jacquee P.

description: Dude. This place is great. Good sushi; very unique. Coming from the OC area, I'd be down to eat here again given I drive 8 hours out to SF again.
author: Dylan N.

description:
Great foods, fresh fish , great service. Black cod saikyo yaki is AWESOME!!!

Great place to checkout.
author: Thorm K.

description: This spot is a great sushi spot: great service and unique and beautiful rolls. This place wasn't too crowded on a Friday night just before New Years  (although I'm sure it's packed other days). We were seated within a minute and the servers came back with drinks and continued to be attentive and serve us quickly throughout the meal--never have I been to a place that's so efficient and friendly! We just kind of chose a couple of random rolls on the menu, but when they came out they were colorful and tasty. You definitely can't go wrong with choosing anything on the menu! Definitely will be back again
author: Emily G.

description: Surprised by how busy this place was. The overall quality of the fish was fresh. I ordered the small plate of chefs choice sashimi and nigiri. My favorite piece of nigiri was the butterfish :) The rolls were different than any typical sushi place so I was pleased. All in all, I will come back.
author: Ricardo R.

description: Food was amazing! Service, not so much. Waited a very long time for food and they rarely refilled empty water glasses.
author: Jackie L.

description: I've been here both times with my partner and we love the sushi here. Only wished the portions were a bit bigger. Otherwise, service was great and enjoyed our date night here.
author: Toro C.

description: Visiting from east coast and found this Great little spot along this eclectic street. Sushi was great and the tuna was amazing. Definitely recommend this as a must try!
author: Connie R.

description: Came to Ginza again for sushi. It was busy and loud but decent food. Had the dragon roll and was delicious. The roll didn't have a lot of fish tho. We also got the tartare appetizer Service was a bit slow. If you check in and post you get a free dessert. The green tea cheesecake was probably the best part of the meal. Overall I'd give it another try if in the area.
author: Emily F.

description: Ordered delivery on a weekend and appreciated that they are open in the mid afternoon when many restaurants are closed.  The sushi was really high quality and fresh.  The Daibaru roll was good (salmon with lemon and more salmon), as was the uni nigiri.  The moriawase was a great value at $30 for 6 pieces of sashimi including toro, salmon and hamachi nigiri, and 6 pieces of nigiri including salmon belly, king salmon, amaebi, and more.  Great find through Yelp!
author: Vivian W.

description:
Everything was pretty mediocre.  Broke my "no sushi on Mondays" rule so maybe that affected things.  Also, they were out of scallop that night.  Got chicken karage, seaweed salad, albacore, Kaiyo roll.  All decent selections but nothing to get excited over, flavor-wise.  Was surprised to see such high reviews on the Yelps.

Nice decor.  Haight parking.  Service was fine.  Happy hour selects look good. Might be a nice place to grab dinner if in the neighborhood but it's not a destination for me.
author: Dan P.

description: Ok food. Too dark. Over priced. Hard to find parking. Period. Eat a ramen somewhere else before coming here. Hmmmmm that's it I think
author: Yixin G.

description: If you want to eat awesome sushi, this is the first restaurant that i will recommend you. You should try it!!!!!!! And you gonna love here. Sushi are fresh. The Amaebi is so sweet. Maguro is sooo tender. Though Uni is a local but it still taste a lil bit sweet.
author: Jay N.

description: Everything was just delicious, especially the Bara roll, which is brand new on the menu.
author: Becci S.

description: Place had amazing food with great lunch specials Monday through the weekend! There food is delicious they accommodate for vegetarians and are friendly
author: Sonam S.

description: I came in recently alone for a hopefully quick and tasty meal.  The server got the quantity wrong of my order the first time, and after I explained repeatedly the situation, I got another round of food that was also not the quantity that I ordered. The sushi was seasoned nicely and I was happy with that, but it took twice as long to get the minimum amount of food that I ordered, but never exactly the amount that I ordered, so I was unhappy with the service.
author: Janelle T.

description: Loved Sakura and Ginza roll! Roll sizes are decent, for the price. Service was fast and server was friendly. Will definitely comeback here and bring my family!
author: Ivee E.

description: Ginza is currently my favorite restaurant in Upper Haight for many reasons.  First off, the sushi is very good -- quality fish and it's delicately prepared.  Try the Sakura roll for a real treat.  Secondly, the non-sushi dishes are excellent.  Salmon Miso Cream is an extraordinary dish.  The secret miso cream sauce is sweet and buttery and it's served with really nice sushi rice and asparagus.  Service is excellent, nice ambiance and prices are reasonable.
author: Drew B.

description:
When the miso and lychee ice tea were served, we knew the rest of the food was going to be amazing. We had the sashimi lunch special and a roll, and it was one of the best sushi we've had in SF. And the green tea cheesecake was a delicious finish! The lovely cosy ambience with a small sushi bar space makes this place an excellent date spot! 

The only downer would be that green tea was $3 with refills though often they are served complimentary at Japanese restaurants.
author: Jan L.

description: Great place. Sushi is fresh, lots of variety. Nice atmosphere. Excellent tuna selection.
author: Leo U.

description: Lychee-tini was delicious as was all the food. We ordered rolls in addition to gyoza and garlic edamame all of which were great. Definitely would recommend. #ginzasf
author: Rebecca P.

description: We were delighted to find Ginza. We had some sushi and it was amazing. We also tried the Gyu steak and its sauce is rich and delicious. Prices are very reasonable compared to what we found in other places of SanFran.
author: Clownaman A.

description:
Ordered sushi from these guys via Eat24.

All the rolls were tiny and expensive. Really upsetting that sushi places rip people off like this.
author: Dennis K.

description:
Try the lychee iced tea. And the dragon roll. Both great choices! 

Had to ask for my miso soup(I think the server forgot). And then I had to wait for a spoon. But they were very accommodating of how we desired the sushi roll combo plated.
author: Tayden J.

description:
So happy about my meal! Ordered the Gy steak and some tempura. All of it so fresh, so sexy and sooooo good 

#ginzasf
author: Tia M.

description: We got the akairo roll, ginza roll, and the fried squid legs. The squid was delicious and the akairo roll was good but we thought the ginza roll was below average. Friendly staff and reasonable prices. The sushi is light and not super fulfilling. The green tea crème brûlée is to die for!
author: Natalie N.

description: Nice atmosphere, friendly service, and delicious food! We ordered the chicken karage, the garlic scallops and the surf and turf roll and were very happy with our choices!
author: Sareena N.

description:
Ginza Sushi was both a hit and a miss. We ordered the cucumber sesame salad, the Dynabite, Barra speciality roll, spicy tuna roll, and Albacore sushi. 

The food tasted good. Definitely 4 stars. A bit expensive but I guess that's the norm in SF. What brought the stars down to a 3 was the service. Took forever to get any attention, waitress was cold and uninviting, and she continuously forgot specifications of the order (such as add jalapeño, sub soy paper, etc). We had to wait for a very long time and it was frustrating. Restaurant was relatively empty as well.

Also, the sushi bar is just for show. We sat there and had no interaction with the chefs.
author: Elir I.

description:
Great service. Happy hour is amazing for two.

Best gyoza ever! Crisp, and flavorful. 


Their fish is fresh. I love their specials. Everything about this place works. Staff is attentive, and friendly. 

Makes me sad that I no longer live in the neighborhood, but will still make the trip for this place.

A+ keep of the great work!
author: Sarah S.

description: This was our first time eating here and it was AMAZING. We ate the Salmon Skin and the Kazan role. Delicious! I would recommend this restaurant to anyone.
author: Naomi B.

description:
Stopped in here for lunch while my husband and I were roaming Haight last weekend.

We each had the lunch special with the rainbow roll and it wasn't bad. Sushi, Miso and their Mule were all decent. Nothing out of this world spectacular. Just okay. It did the job. We were hungry and it filled us up. I would have been just as satisfied (for about $30 less) had we gone to Chipotle instead.
author: Kaitlin F.

description: The green tea was not the best since it was very strong to the point where I couldn't finish my cup. My suggestion to them is to put less green tea in people's cups. I'm a really big fan of miso soup but this sushi restaurant had way too much sodium/salt in their miso soup, they need to add less salt to their miso soup. The sushi was good, I ordered the Akairo roll, Suisei roll and Rainbow roll. All were tasty but they could have made my rainbow roll a bigger portion compared to other sushi places that I order rainbow rolls from. I'd come back here but I wouldn't go out my way to do so.
author: Mo I.

description:
Very good sushi 
Perfect Saturday lunch 
Good service
 Free drinks thanks to yelp 

#ginzasf
author: Victor L.

description: We loved the food! Get the ginza and kaiyo rolls, the spicy flavors were amazing. Lots of jalapeño and spicy tuna flavor.
author: Jacqueline S.

description: Ginza roll is fantastic! This is our new favorite spot for sushi! Great service and wonderful ambiance. Also great specials. #ginzasf
author: Bryan K.

description: Each bowl of garlic edamame is shipped to the Vatican, where it's blessed by the pope.  After it travels back on a private jet, it's brought to Disneyland, where it basks in the happiness of thousands of happy children.  Finally, a unicorn snuggles with it and enjoys 4 episodes of Top Chef with it before it's brought to your table on a silk pillow.
author: Michael S.

description: Delicious edamame for appetizer. Make sure you're okay with garlicky breadth because they don't mess around with it (in the best of ways). Having the Chef selection Nigiri and Sashimi is a fun adventure if you are indecisive. Very nice service and yummy food. Would come back!
author: Cesar C.
