description: I like having this as a sushi option in the Haight. The rolls are decent and the atmosphere is fine. I've never managed to crave anything from here. I prefer to got to citrus club across the street (not a sushi spot, but a bomb noodle place) when I'm in the area. Also, I ordered a roll for take out and it didn't even come with wasabi or ginger.
author: Caitlin G.

description:
The restaurant is on Haight, and looked very hip with its dark décor, high-energy music, and young clientele.  This all made me a little skeptical of the food.  Are we going to eat nothing but saucy rolls?  Will everything taste better after a drink?

Well, I was wrong.  The nigiri we ordered were great.  Hotate, Hamachi, uni, all were well done.  The special, engawa, a lightly seared halibut fin (I could be completely wrong anatomically and even with the species), was delicious!

Their agedashi tofu was silky and done perfectly. And they have fried squid tentacles for those who find them suddenly in the mood for a plate of fried calamari. 

Great place for a meal with friends or family.
author: Candice B.

description: We come here often and it's a great neighborhood place. We especially like the Bara Roll and the edamame. It's usually not too busy and we've never had to wait.
author: Sarah C.

description: Great food taste amazing. The staff was very friendly and the food was prepared quickly.
author: Brittany C.

description: The sushi is great and the atmosphere is impeccable. Good for a business meeting after work. Could also be a great date spot.
author: Kodie C.

description:
Really love lychee iced tea! Yummm
Must try sakura roll it's amazing and looks pretty.
author: Wan-Chen L.

description: I love their lychee tea and sushi rolls! It is so hard to find such  a classic Japanese restaurant in San Francisco.
author: Anthony H.

description: Delicious sushi and sashimi for great value. Beautiful presentation. Attentive and quick service, not loud, and nice ambiance. Great for a date.
author: V L.

description:
So delicious! Beautiful sushi and presentation. Ginza mule was amazing and refreshing after a hot hike through Golden gate park.

The service was amazing and friendly. Our entire group was very happy.
author: Cara E.

description:
This is was my second time since they were open. In the first time me and my girlfriend  had try Moriawase and Black Cod Saikyo Yaki(all delicious). So for this time we decide to try something new. We order :
Tomodashi tartare - YUMM! It was very good by itself and with the sauce
Cucumber Sesame - very refreshing, perfect seasoning 
Chirashi Bowl - You can't go wrong with this. Reasonable price and very fresh fish
Uni tasting - This is DA BOMBBBB. Both Uni very fresh. Sweet and creamy. Japan Uni very very sweet. 

Will be back again.
author: Mote V.

description: Everything was fresh! Came in during rush hour. They're happy hour menu selection looks great. Price was decent. Excellent for a night out with friends. #ginzasf
author: Benison Y.

description: The food was sublime. I was treated very well by Sushi chef T! He was a great conversationalist, let me sample one of his creations, and even gave me advice on a good sushi knife. Truly a once in a lifetime experience.
author: James W.

description: Ginza sushi is my go to sushi restaurant when I have a craving that can only be satisfied by sushi. How can I sum up their sushi? One word: explosive-good. The hyphen makes it one word. I live by my own rules. Also, THIS SUSHI RULES.
author: Jordan K.

description: Service is really good-sushi was delicious. The miso cream sauce was life-changing, the salmon was overcooked. The water is amazing. Ambiance is also very fresh, laid back and friendly. Be careful to indicate you want to order off lunch menu during lunchtime or they might charge you dinner prices at lunch like they did with us.
author: Megan T.

description: Great sushi! I really liked the Ginza and Daburu rolls! It was amazing! The place is really nice designed with great atmosphere.
author: Moshe A.

description: I ordered delivery through Yelp. The delivery itself was fine, but the quality of food was a little underwhelming for the price (story of my life in San Francisco). Rolls were decent but quite small in size. Avoid the nigiri as they don't smell and taste super fresh. I'm sure the fishiness was covered up by the other sauces/ingredients in the rolls.
author: Louisa T.

description: My family was craving Spider Rolls. Decided to try this spot out for the first time. Atmosphere was great and severs were very attentive. When our plates were initially set on the table my first thought was the crab looked way over cooked. I took one bite and  was so disappointed. There was no flavor, which I've never experienced. It was definitely over cooked. The the most prominent flavor to the roll was oil. We will definitely not be returning.
author: Vicki H.

description: This restaurant is incredibly delicious. The ambiance is very nice for a weekend date. Their sushi is high quality and fresh. I recommend the ginza roll and Philadelphia. I also got the sushi platter and fresh wasabi, which was also delicious. Their alcoholic selections are great. Try their German ales.
author: Benjamin K.

description:
This is a 3.5 stars review. 

First time hubs & I cam here we just had some oysters and the fried octopus legs, that were so good a week later we came for a full dinner. 

Coming from the peninsula we are used to big generous portions, which was not the case here. The nigiri and the roll were "small. The nigiri were good, not great, I would preferred the fish to be much colder. Even though we usually love tuna, here it kinda felt like a supermarket sushi. "T" the amazing chef who was preparing our food, noticed that we weren't very satisfied with it offered us complimentary Toro which were tasty. I really appreciate people going above and beyond to please their customers and T definitely did, Kudos!

The sayuri roll was average in our opinion, but the octopus legs appetizer was as good as the first time! 

I wouldn't come here for a full meal honestly, but I'd come back fro some oysters and fried octopus legs
author: Tamara S.

description:
Ambiance is lovely, cozy and nice mood music. Service is excellent. Ordered the Firecraker Salmon-excellent, Spider Roll-excellent, Akairo Roll-average & Rainbow Poki Salad was good too but would of liked a little bit more dressing/sauce on it. Waiting for my green tea cheesecake, their homemade dessert. It sounds delicious! I would definitely come back here.

Ok, didn't get to try the homemade green tea cheesecake but I did have the green tea ice cream and the Lychee drink - yum!!!
author: T M.

description: We ordered two chef's specials, ginza and Sakura-both with the perfect combination of sweet and savory notes that crescendoed into a beautiful explosion of musical tastiness. Additionally, the fried chicken appetizer with the chipotle mayo sauce (I think) was incredible!
author: Liliana Q.

description: Great sushi place! Beautiful and tasty rolls. I can get picky when it comes to sushi but this place overcome all my expectations. Had the, albacore sashimi, tuna nigiri, seaweed salad and some vegetarian roll and also tried my friend order of the deep fried spicy tuna with another thing I can't remember. Everything was delicious and service was good too. Will be back for sure!
author: Tamar T.

description:
Had a random day off work so came here for lunch at noon. The website has a lunch menu listed, but when I came in I was offered a dinner menu and a happy hour menu. I asked for a lunch menu, but the waiter said they didn't have one. That was frustrating enough, because with a dinner menu comes dinner prices. 

I could deal if the food was pretty good. But alas, my salmon dish was under-seasoned. The miso sauce didn't do anything to brighten the flavor. The rice didn't have a particularly nice texture and had little flavor. Miso salmon at Cheesecake Factory is better. 

My fish also took a while despite being one of the only customers in the restaurant. 

The decor is nice and I could see the appeal if you were looking for ambiance first and foremost. Maybe the sushi is good,but there are so many other places to try before I would hedge my bets.
author: Alex C.

description: Great sushi and always great service! Order the classic rolls. Sashimi is yummy, as well.
author: Elena L.

description: This was one of the best sushi experiences of my life. Amazing place, environment, super friendly people, great drinks and the sushi is out of this planet. Freshest fish ever and also very meticulosly executed. Best spot to eat sushi, 100000% recommended
author: Laura B.

description:
This was a cute, intimate little spot. Good spot for dinner with friends or a date night. The people who sat us and cleared our table for us were extremely friendly and helpful. We had to wait a little bit longer than originally stated and they apologized and brought us water which was extremely nice of them. Great staff. 
So the nigiri was delicious. They offered a wide variety Nigiri and sashimi. It was beautifully presented on the plate too. 
So I got the ginger chicken and the tempura vegetable plate. The ginger chicken was okay. The chicken was tender but a little dry and fatty in some areas. There wasn't a lot of flavor and I wouldn't get it again. 
The vegetable tempura was excellent. So much flavor and I love the dipping sauce they provide with it. Sweet and salty sauce. 
Definitely a cute place and would go back again.
author: Melissa M.

description: Would not recommend eating here . In the first place it took a while for my food alone to come I ordered the stake and it had lots of fat . My friend ordered an avocado roll which took over 45 minutes and she did not get her food until I was already done with mine . At this point we asked our server to take it off the tab due to us not wanting to wait or pay for food that took so long . She then asked if we wanted a Togo bag so she could still charge us . Even waiting for the bill it took forever . Would not suggest eating there
author: Breanna O.

description: While exploring most of San Francisco we found this place by chance and were in the mood for sushi. I got the udon noodles, my sisters got sushi. I would definitely recommend eating here! The food was good, the service was very good. These guys know what they are doing.
author: Cameron E.

description: There are Great vegetarian options. It's in a Good location.  Check out the lychee Tini! Reasonably priced too.
author: Catherine T.

description:
Wow. I now have a favorite sushi place in SF (and I don't even like sushi).

Everything was *very* good. We had firecracker salmon, the salmon in cream sauce, mixed tempura, and poke salad. Even the miso soup and rice were standouts. The lava cake desert was fine but not a stand out. Asahi beer on draft.

Will def return to this place!
author: Scott K.

description: 10/10 would recommend and come back again!  I had the surf and turf roll, which was yummy! Definitely check in to try the lychee iced tea!
author: Joy K.

description: This is the first sushi restaurant I have tried a since I moved to SF. The Dragon Roll was delicious and well-balanced. The Kanzu Roll is also quite a treat as it is a baked roll. I very much enjoyed the atmosphere, which was more traditional as opposed to modern. The candle at the table was a nice touch and added to the ambiance.
author: Aaron C.

description: Solid sushi place; had a Groupon, and fun was had by all. Ginza, dragon, and spicy tuna rolls all good. Would definitely return for happy hour!
author: Shendi X.

description: Usually afraid to randomly try sushi, garlic edamame was great,  and spicy tuna did not disappoint,  wife enjoyed a poki salad,  good choice.
author: Patrick D.

description: Cool atmosphere and great specials. The hot sake was perfect. The service was spot on. #ginzasf
author: Justin L.

description: I love their sushi. It is delicious even though it is a little pricey. I would suggest the Ginza roll and Danburu Roll. I hope to return here.
author: Will D.

description: Randomly found this place while walking around the city because I was craving sushi and I'm glad I did. Great customer service and food/drinks were delicious.
author: Michael T.

description: This is one of the best restaurants I have eaten at in San Francisco.  The prices were very reasonable as well!
author: Shammah C.

description: Below-average sushi, the fish pieces were thin and the rolls didn't taste like much other than the sauce that went with it. The tempura was a bit undercooked too.
author: Jaco L.

description: This is a quaint place with great food and nice service. The scallops are amazing and the rolls are a good price.
author: Kanya H.

description: The staff is super friendly, but the sushi is not up to par with other sushi restaurants in the city. The gyoza was oddly crunchy in texture and had a weird flavor. The actual sushi was not great and have had better sushi from "to go" places.
author: Bradley V.

description: Hip ambiance, good for date night. We enjoyed the soft shell crab roll, hamachi, and hotate. Sake kama was nicely seasoned and melt-in-your-mouth buttery. I'd skip the uni and try other nigiri next time. Love the dessert here. It's so pretty and delicious. The perfect way to end your meal :9
author: Therese W.

description: Neat aesthetic with good service and food you'd expect from a quality sushi place. The lunchtime sushi bento box is a nice quick bite for two when you're both craving sushi and aren't just looking for loaded rolls.
author: カエル

description:
Garlic Edamame, so good!
Rainbow Roll, one of the best I've had
Daburu Roll, refreshing and delicious
Toro Sushi, melts in your mouth (as it should)
Yellowtail Sashimi, delicious

Def on my repeat list of SF Sushi joints
author: William N.

description:
I'm not sure how this place got such high ratings but then again I looked around me and there was not one Asian person..

So everything was salty :(

- chicken Karage was 4 bigger pieces of overly fried and salty chicken. Dried but it was fried too long

- the dragon roll was the slumpest sad looking roll I've seen. The shrimp tempura was soggy (not crispy like Sakesan Bistro-go there)

- Ginza roll was seared hamachi with jalapeño lacking flavor.

- my husband got the tofu steak, which was also salty.

The food was less than mediocre. Salty.

Our server was very friendly but slow service with us seated by the door, that would get stuck halfway each time someone entered or left.

Would not go back here
author: Vanae W.

description:
5 star service - especially at the sushi bar
Awesome food - sushi was so fresh, I could tell they are really good quality. 
Cozy/cool ambiance
Perfect place for your sushi fix
author: Jenny N.

description: Yummy sushi and chill atmosphere! Samarai sake, akuru  roll and chicken w/ asparagus. Service is great and prices are reasonable! refreshing and different menu
author: Blyss L.

description:
Decided to try this before pinball league at Free Gold Watch since I wasn't looking for anything too heavy and got in during their happy hour which was from 4-6 and includes specials at a discount so I got two of them - the Agedashi tofu and gyoza.

The tofu was tasty and crisp on the outside but nice and soft inside.  It was just right and pretty tasty and for $5 a good deal.  The gyoza was pretty solid, but I still say my mom's is tops but maybe that's not a fair comparison :)

I also got two nigiri - sake and shiro maguro both of which were pretty decent tasting but the portions aren't that large.  A good value overall though and definitely a spot I'd hit up.  My favorite sushi in SF is still Sushi Zone so take that as a data point...
author: Gene X.

description:
I give Ginza 5 stars for presentation! 
Love the atmosphere of the restaurant and the sushi rolls are delicious. Very fresh ingredients.
author: Pamela L.

description: Delicious sushi and great service. We tried the poki salad, Ginza roll and Surf and turf roll. All great! Nice ambiance too.
author: Lisa S.

description: Fantastic food, nice atmosphere and really awesome service. The salmon firecracker was great and the signature rolls are very special and tasteful. Never experience rolls like that. We also have had a tofu steak which was delicious as well. Definitely recommendable.
author: Zurück Auf S.

description: Tried with groupon for the first time.  Only good for Mon-Thus, not valid for lunch menu, have to order thru dinner menu even you are there for lunch.  Thought the green tea is coming with the dinner menu but was charged $2.95 for Glass of hot tea with strainer, charged us $5.90 for 2 teas.  Although was from dinner menu - Salmon miso cream sauce was small portion with 2 pcs. of asparagus with bowl of rice, was bit pricey for $17.  And the miso sauce didn't have much miso taste.  Asked what's in the sauce - she didn't know.  The plate they use was nice. Don't think we go back there again.
author: phillip b.

description: Delicious sushi! We had 4 rolls and are completely stuffed. Ambiance is relaxed, plus we get to see the cubs trashing the Indians on TV! You should get the Miso soup, its delicious! #ginzasf
author: Gabriel P.

description: Was really good! Got the ginger chicken, and it was fantastic.  Eric got a roll and hamachi nigiri and everything was fresh and beautiful.
author: Ingrid M.

description: AMAZING sushi and good service. Fresh fish!!! Black cod saikyo yaki is highly recommend.
author: Nida M.

description: Great sushi and saki.  The crab sushi is amazing.  The sake is good and onky 8 bucks.   And free dessert when you post a good reviee.  Awesome deal!   Stop by on way to outside lands.
author: Trecker J.

description:
I usually won't write a review until I've dined at a restauraunt at least three times. 

After three visits, Ginza is still 5 stars in my book! I've tried much of the menu and have been pleased with every dish. It's really great to have a new place to dine so close to home. 

Highlights: Fresh sushi, Gyoza, Miso Soup, Garlic Edename 

Welcome to the neighborhood Ginza, I'll be back soon!
author: Jeremy C.

description: I have never left a bad yelp review but the people here were rude to us and it took an hour to get two rolls -  there was no one in the restaurant and it was a Tuesday night. Not sure if this was just an off day or indicative of the place itself. Anyways, rolls were alright. A little overpriced.
author: Lauren H.

description: Great Happy Hour!  Attentive waitstaff. If I could have given 4 1/2 stars I would have. Sushi is fresh and beautiful. Lovely candlelit atmosphere.
author: Jeanette N.

description: Expensive compared to most places, but it is on haight st. So what do you expect? Also I love tempura sushi (fried) but the fried one from here was too much. The whole roll was fried and didn't taste like sushi anymore :( just the top of the roll would have been good
author: Sarah G.

description:
Ginza is our go-to sushi spot in the Haight. We were so glad when they opened in Dec 2015 - our hood was hungry for excellent sushi, and they do not disappoint! 

We come 2-3 times/mth, and each time the food quality is superb, the wait staff are friendly and efficient and Ming is just the best owner - everything you would want in a local business!

Thank you for your high standards, we sushi lovers appreciate it :-)
author: Anna C.

description: Super delicious nigiri!! They were out of uni and scallop but whatever. Nigiri and sake made for a great evening
author: Savannah F.

description: Went here and I'm surprised there's such a great sushi place on Haight. The service was excellent, the sushi was a slight wait but well worth it. #ginzasf
author: James Z.

description: This place is good. I had the chicken karage salad and the seared sake belly nigiri. Both were excellent. Texture and flavor were on-point. However, service was kind of slow for it not being busy at all and the credit card reader was down. I'll definitely be back if I'm in the neighborhood though
author: Jeff M.

description:
Super happy a sushi place finally opened in the Upper Haight.  Thank goodness it's delicious.  No need for Haight Street Market sushi anymore ;).

This is an awesome date place and fun meet up place for friends.  Great food, good music, super nice and attentive staff, large space, good lighting.  I went with my roommate, and it was SooOoO romantic.

Very reasonably priced.

We got miso soup, green tea, the spider roll, daburu roll, ginza roll, and the sashimi/nigiri plate.  Everything was very very fresh.  This was the best spider roll I ever had.  I didnt' even know it could taste that good.  I mentioned this to our waitress, Ming, and she told me that everything is made-to-order and not prepared beforehand.  They don't even batter the soft-shell crab until it's ordered.  My favorites were the  sashimi plate and the daburu roll - can't go wrong with ultra fresh salmon and lemon.

Would certainly come back... maybe weekly.  Especially when the happy hour starts back up.
author: Andrew N.

description:
a new japanese place on the upper haight. the ambiance is hip with high ceiling. and the menu is the combination of your standard rolls, fancy nigiri including japanese and santa barbara uni, and some yummy-sounding entrees. so they are not your standard japanese place. you can try new japanese things if you'd like. we've got:

hamachi kama (collar) - from the special menu. awesomeness. but you have to gnaw on the fish bones to get all the good stuff out. totally into it.
akairo roll - yeah roll... 
salmon skin roll - the skin rolled into the roll is a bit burned..
gyoza - kinda tasteless. the filling is light in flavor. 

oh and we've got free green tea cheesecake with social media checkin and stuff. the cheesecake is delicious. 

i wouldn't mind coming back again to try more things on the entree menu!
author: Te R.

description:
So happy to have a sushi restaurant in the haight. I have come here many times and they are definitely learning fast on how to run a good service :) 

I'll be back again! T knows how to make a roll! Custom ones and creative ones, they do a great job at servicing the customer. Will be back soon!
author: Dylan B.

description: Great service! Awesome presentation with the food. Awesome anime mural on the wall. The sushi was great. I left my glasses in the restaurant and the kind lady kept it in a bag and wrote the date and purchase number on it in case I returned looking for it. Thumbs up
author: Ardika S.

description: Lot of room for improvement here as they are new and still getting their $h!t together.  The rolls are a bit small and tasteless.  The hamachi kama was DRY, which is the biggest no no you can have.  The uni was pretty tasty but it was the size of a pinky toe.  Prices are definitely high which is fine as long as you beef up the quality, but when you have crappy quality + high prices that results in this semi-angry review I'm writing.
author: Vince L.

description: Ginza has a great atmosphere and amazing food. I love their salmon with miso cream sauce and their house salad has delicious dressing. I am a regular, and plan to keep coming back, for take out or a fun night out.
author: Eliza R.

description: I always enjoy coming here. The atmosphere is great and the food is delicious. I love the ginger chicken and the sushi is amazing!
author: Greg S.

description: Food was delicious but WAY overpriced the had rolls are the same as a full roll. The $$ should be $$$$
author: Lorren W.

description: Worst service I ever had. Sushi was good but the service was so mediocre, that it took away from the food. To add to my frustration, the service got our bill wrong four times! She finally got it right and a half hour later, we got out of there. If I wanted to be frustrated, I would sit in traffic.
author: Marcelo A.

description:
This restaurant service was small but it was nice. The food was good, like the edamame with grilled garlic and ginger sauce.  They also give you a free miso soup.  the chicken karaage, and the kappa roll and a little bit of sake are the foods I ordered, but the drink I prefer is the lychee ice tea. The food portions were a little bit small. The bathroom was clean and decent but small. This restaurant was very clean and big.  There is a place that you can see them making food.

*submitted by me and my nine year old nephew
author: Ernest S.

description: Perfection! Ginza is a roomy and elegant sushi joint, with a friendly staff and a really rocking samurai wall. I ordered simply, the Japanese blue fin hand roll, seaweed salad, and some warm sake. Everything was really fresh and delicious, but the bluefin especially shone through. I know where I'm taking my sushi dates!
author: Ruth M.

description:
The sushi here is pretty delish. I got the moriawase and was super pleased with it. Presentation and flavor was great. Service was friendly and accommodating.

I'm not a fan of lychee flavored things, but their lychee iced tea is so darn good.
author: Tiffany N.

description: Let me say this: the FOOD is amazing. It is my favorite sushi place in San Francisco hands down. Every flavor is unique and delicious - the gyoza is the best I've ever had, the drinks are super scrumptious, the ginger is flavorful and potent. The first time I came, the service was exceptional. The second time I came, it was mediocre at best. We were waiting for our ticket to come for at least 20 minutes (probably more) before one of us finally went to the bar to ask for it. We also didn't get our waters until after we'd received our food.  So I give this place 4 stars, which is a 5 for the food and a 3 for the service. Still worth coming though, I love the food so much I can overlook the service (but not everyone feels that way so it is worth mentioning).
author: Jessalyn D.

description:
I've worked in the Haight for over 20 years and there has never been good sushi west of Divisadero.  FINALLY the curse has been lifted and Ginza appeared!   

The food is solid.  I took my order to go so I could go back to work but while waiting took in the new atmosphere.  Clean, modern, zen. It is hard to believe this once was loud Kan Zaman.  There is a TV but it was on silent and the Food Network was on!

I ordered the lunch roll special.  For 11 dollars you get 4pc. California roll, 4pc. spicy tuna roll and a choice of a dragon roll, rainbow roll or chef selection roll.  Super tasty.  The rice was perfect.  I also got the kara-age.  Perfectly crisp, although I would have liked a little kick to it.

The staff was very nice and look forward to going back and dining in.  Welcome to the hood guys.  I hope this is a sign that good food is a part of the Upper Haight now.
author: Monika S.

description: The sushi was very fresh. I got the spicy tuna roll and miso soup. Wonderful sake selection and cool vibe. Best restaurant on haight st.
author: Erica O.

description: Amazing sushi and service!! The uni was ridiculously fresh. Def recommend trying this place out
author: Bianca A.

description:
This is amazing, food is great , that s the first time I went to a sushi with such great entrées. Service is also perfect, they are doing everything to satisfy the customer. 

Last but not least it is everything: fresh, tasty, good looking... And very reasonably priced :)

Go there. Period.
author: Matt H.

description: I came here after hanging out in Golden Gate park. I am vegetarian so I shared the Tofu Steak and Tera roll. The sauce on the Tofu Steak was lovely. Nice, sweet flavor yet very savory. I felt the portion was a little small considering the price. The Tera roll had very unique ingredients. I haven't seen that combination in a roll before which was exciting because usually vegetarian rolls are not very innovative. I enjoyed the roll but it didn't wow me. The presentation is nice though and it was fun to try something new. We ordered the fried ice cream for dessert. It wasn't as hot (temperature-wise) as I've normally had it. The dough was more cakey than crunchy. But it was still yummy. Overall, this sushi place is fine; nothing special but not bad if you're in the mood.
author: Maggie B.

description: Took a day trip from Stockton to explore around the city. We came across this spot and initially passed it up after reading the menu, I'm glad we changed our mind. We were greeted and seated quickly by a friendly host. The food delivery was perfectly timed and well proportioned. Great low-key, quiet and dim environment. Ended up spending $40 on 2 rolls, a big bowl of delicious edamame and 2 of the strawberry-lemonades w/ saki. Definitely will be back!
author: Jonathan M.

description: Loved the sake cocktail we had, I forget the name but it was green with a cucumber slice. Very refreshing drink. Good sushi, relaxed atmosphere, good service.
author: Sarah V.

description:
The servers are extremely friendly, but I seemed to have a little trouble communicating with them. I asked for warm water and she gave me water from the pitcher with ice. So I asked for hot water, and she gave me near-boiling water! I didn't realize how hot it was since it was in a clear glass, and I burnt my tongue trying to take a sip. 

I know, that was probably my bad. But why would you serve a customer something that hot, in a clear glass, without even warning them!? Losing all those tastebuds really put a damper on the rest of my meal.

I got the Sushi Lunch (6 nigiri, 4 CA, 4 tuna, large miso soup). The nigiri, especially the unagi, were very good! The rolls were ok. They didn't seem quite as fresh as the nigiri. Portion overall was small, but that's what I wanted. Maybe a bit overpriced considering the amount of food. But I would totally go back for the unagi.
author: A -.

description: Wow, I was so impressed by this place! I love the ambiance. I really appreciate the excellent service and the superb food. The Firecracker and Ginza are delicious. Thanks Ginza Sushi! See you again!
author: Steph L.

description: Did you ever have a very " FRESH " tuna and salmon Tartare ? OMG , You might also love it
author: Nathan H.

description: This place is great. The sushi is delicious and well-presented and the servers are super nice. My boyfriend and I are regulars and the servers have gotten to know us and always remember our order. We usually get the Bento Box lunch special and it comes with miso soup, a small plate of shrimp and veggie tempura, two rolls, sashimi and nigiri for under $20. Crazy good deal. I recommend this place to anyone looking for great sushi.
author: Dustin M.

description: Awful! I tried this place because I was in the area and really wanted some sushi. Based off the reviews I figured it had to at least be ok/average. I was so wrong! The service was awful after the waitress took my order and brought my drink I never saw her again after that and sushi was below average. I got spicy tuna with tasted just like any other restaurant's except they gave me a pinch of the spicy mayo. I also got a spider roll which was the worst spider roll I've ever tasted. I've never had a cold spider roll or one with burnt soft shell crab. Their surf and turf roll was pretty decent but definitely not worth the $35 bill. You are better off going next door and paying $5 for a slice of pizza from Escape for New York.
author: Alexandria M.

description: The Akairo roll was amazing!! I also loved the lychee tea  I highly recommend this place! The servers are very nice as well, especially Lisa!
author: Negin K.

description: Best sushi I've had in San Francisco by far! I have been searching for great sushi ever since I moved to SF but I just happened to stumble in here and I was blow away by how good it was! The service was also great. I rarely if ever do Yelp reviews but I had to for this place!
author: Dan D.

description: Great service. Ingredients are super fresh. The Aburi Engawa Nigari was really tender. Make sure to come during happy hours. Hot Sake was only $5.
author: Jimmy L.

description:
Love it!! Recommend to make a reservation for Friday night. This sushi place was so fresh and delicious. The atmosphere is fun and hip, great for parties. Price is not too bad but you know what you're getting!!

Moriawase $50 - OMG so worth (8pcs sushi and 12 pcs sashimi). Melt in your mouth, fresh cuts beautiful presentation.

Cod tasting $10 - delicious and tasty

Kaiyo roll $13 - So Good!! I like fried potato on top of this roll make it more yummy.

Service - Very friendly & gave excellent recommendations.
author: Jinjutha D.

description: This place has garlic edamame that's to die for. Smoke a doobie then order that ish and thank me later. They have a samauri drink here that's great for your Instagram story game to show u have cooler drinks than ur friends at the club not being as fancy as yu.  It's so lit (slit)
author: Taylor W.

description:
I needed a go-to neighborhood sushi spot and I think i've found it in Ginza. The restaurant interior is modern and nice and there is a lot of seating so I don't foresee wait to be an issue. I've been twice and have really enjoyed the rolls i've ordered- they're both fresh and flavorful.

I have docked a star as a result of my second experience; it took quite some time to bring out the sushi roll and then only to learn they've brought out the wrong one. The staff handled the situation very gracefully, apologized and told us to keep the wrong roll as they brought out the right one. Unfortunately, they brought out the wrong roll again. We didn't mention it and just enjoyed the roll served which was quite delicious. I will attribute the experience to them being brand new and working out the kinks. Despite the wait and mishap, I still had a pleasant dining experience with fresh rolls with excellent flavors. For this reason, I recommend trying them out.
author: Caroline L.

description: This is seriously one of the best sushi places I've been to. It's very nice and spacious and the staff was friendly. They have pretty good price for what you're getting. Also, be sure to check-in and get a free lychee tea. That tea was so good, I would actually pay for one next time I come here.
author: Beverly C.

description: Food was good and affordable. The area is dead center on haight street so parking wasnt fun but not bad. We went on tuesday night around 6 pm l and there was no wait. Staff was friendly. Rolls were sort of small but i have no complaints. Dim lighting and nice interior so it would be good for a date
author: Lina K.

description: This place is awesome high end sushi with a neighborhood feel. The owner came over and said hi and chatted with us like old friends. And the quality of the fish is top notch. We were pulled in by the buzz of activity, the great graphic murals, and the clean earthy smell of their special today. But I will be back because of the yummy food and the great service.
author: sonja h.

description: Sushi is not great, fish is fresh but they use too much rice and the rice is not sushi rice. Tartare was very good. Everything else is mediocre, not as good as the pics. If you order tea it comes out like, fucking boiling don't even try to touch it until you've finished your entire meal...nice ambiance though
author: Jessica S.

description: A very stunning and roomy location just a 15-minute walk from the University of San Francisco. At the first glimpse, you can't help but notice the neighborhood that surrounds the izakaya. I would highly recommend either parking up by the university and then taking the bus line 33 or just walk. I ordered the chicken karage and salmon skin roll. The karage was good but the salmon skin seemed to fall apart on me while using my chopsticks. The salmon skin roll was a bit overpowering. The crushed salmon skin was like eating crushed bark. I'm sure to visit again and try the other dishes before really giving a thorough review. The three-star rating is based on convenience of location for students who want to eat somewhere off campus that is close by and affordable. I also recommend using the yelp check in to get the free lychee ice tea!
author: Gilbert S.

description: Came here on a Tuesday night with my girlfriend and had a wonderful time. Nice servers and great ambiance. We ordered the uni tasting which was only $12 and it tasted super fresh! The uni was from  Santa Barbara and Hokkaido. Will be back.
author: Ricky M.

description:
Stopped in for lunch since I live right around the corner. Simple menu, reasonable prices, and the food was pretty good. They need to work a bit on the atmosphere (large, cold room with odd house music and lots of echoes) but I have high hopes that they will survive the first few months of business and remain as a neighborhood stable. If they could drop the ceiling or something it could be a really nice spot, feels a bit like a warehouse at the moment.

Lunch: Bento w/ fried tofu and vegetables, added shrimp+vegetable tempura ($2) and tea ($3). Just under $20 including tip. In and out in around 30 minutes, I'll likely be back.
author: Kevin S.

description: Ginza was so yummy! I recommend the surf and turf sushi for those who don't like seafood! Really tasty meal
author: Erin W.

description: Good food and great service! Definitely would come back. Plus, we tried uni tasting and that was pretty good!
author: Ruji C.

description: Great service, really fresh food, pleasant atmosphere. Ordered the butterfish carpaccio and ginza roll. Plus lychee iced tea was yummy.
author: Julie S.

description: Service was incredibly slow.  Waited 15+ minutes to have order taken.  Took another 40 minutes to get 1 entree and 1 roll (neither of which are cooked!)  And she the order wrong! Terrible experience.   Ruined my evening.  So cranky now.  I'm going to go next door for a slice of pizza to make me happy again.  Awful Awful!!!
author: Jack T.

description:
We live in the neighborhood and noticed Ginza while we were walking by... finally a winner on Upper Haight!

Atmosphere: dark wood finishing / clean / cozy / simple
Service: very attentive / friendly
Food: super fresh / really enjoyed delicious and unique rolls 
**Ginza (house roll): B+ --- I liked this roll a lot but would almost shy away from searing the yellow tail
**Daburu: A+  --- super refreshing with the salmon and lemon rind combo

I'll be back to try the sashimi.
author: Kerry P.

description: The restaurant is good. I ate Kazan and Spider rolls and Karaage!! They're perfect.  I'll be back
author: Arisa T.

description: First, some positives: this is the best sushi on Haight Street...and, we didn't get sick. Sadly, is it is the *only* sushi on Haight. There are four seats at the sushi bar if you want to stare at saran-wrapped fish and be asked to order everything from the server, not the sushi chef. The chefs reveal their lack of training in the quality of their rice and tamago, both have incorrect texture and flavor. Fish quality was very average. They were out of half of the nigiri we ordered. The tempura was cold, as if it was prepared in advance. Our server was on the phone twice, holding it to her ear with her shoulder as she delivered food to our table. I wanted to love this place due to the high Yelp ratings. Sadly it is below par in SF with so many other great choices these days. I would summarize Ginza as a rookie attempt. I'm sure young families will go there for california rolls that their kids can drop on the floor and  the restaurant will survive.
author: Jonathan B.

description: Excellent experience!  The sushi was fresh, fairly priced, and tasted terrific. Plenty of specialty rolls that were worth trying.
author: Matt W.

description: Our new favorite spot. Incredible food, wonderful service. Sashimi and nigiri are fresh and cut/presented perfectly. Such a necessary cure for the horrible food I had at the *last* place I visited in Cole Valley
author: Amelia C.

description: Pretty good vibes and modern look and feel, will come next time whenever in need of food around
author: Dave Z.

description: I really like this restaurant!! I work down the street and it's becoming my go to for lunch. They have reasonable prices and the staff are friendly
author: Meme W.

description: Cool japanese place on Haight Street. Rolls and steak was good. Good atmosphere. We will come back. Sushi chefs were nice and service was great. Parking was little hard so definitely uber or lyft here.
author: Sherry B.

description: This place is a rip off. The sushi was tiny as F@cK. For 2 rolls and 2 sodas was $27. WTF ..  Bagel Bites are bigger
author: Eric H.

description: We've been here 3 times now, it usually doesn't have a wait and is great for groups. However the sushi has been mediocre at best and the service is pretty slow.  They do the standard rolls just fine, but their fancy rolls have been underwhelming. But it's a nice atmosphere for a bit of a fancier dinner.
author: Maggie H.

description: came here for first time with my friend from Colombia. she has never had sushi before! place has great atmosphere. sushi looks very fresh and yummy! waitress is very nice and accommodating. would definitely come back again!!
author: Angie B.

description:
Definitely a killer spot for sushi. Good rolls, good quality fish, fast service, and reasonable prices. 

Garlic edamame - A+ this was bomb, definitely recommend it, a little heavier than normal but nice having the salt from the soy sauce.

Kaiyo was my favorite roll by far, super tasty and unique. We also got the Kazan which was really good but a little more difficult to eat, fell apart a little more cuz it was warm (which was a good thing for taste)

We also got the daburu and Katsura, both were good but lighter then the first too, definitely some
Unique flavors with the lemon.
author: Emory S.

description: Great Atmosphere and easy to get a table on a Friday night. The food was solid with nice presentation! I'd come back!
author: Kelly H.

description: Fresh fish, delicious rolls, and the friendliest sushi chefs I have had the pleasure to dine with in a long while! The ambiance was great to share a lovely evening with a good friend, too. Try their sake (salmon) sashimi - I ended up getting a second order because it was so good, and for the first time I couldn't finish all my sushi! You won't be disappointed :)
author: Ruby C.

description: We got Ginza roll and Suisei roll and they were delicious. The house made cucumber salad (Sunomono) is to die for! Chirashi (Sashimi and rice) is so refreshing! Friendly staff as well! Definitely coming back!
author: Will K.

description: This is our favorite local sushi place.  The chef's choice is a fantastic selection.  Everything is super fresh and made with attention to detail.  Really like the shrimp and veggie tempura - the shrimp are big and the batter is light and crispy.  Service is always excellent and very friendly.  Take out is available but atmosphere is nice too - not too noisy.  Highly recommend this place.
author: Karen S.

description:
I was thrilled enough that a sushi place opened up in my hood. The fact that it was exceptional, sent me to the moon. This place is amazing! I sat at the bar with chefs Tommy and T and started with the sushi / sashimi sampler. All the cuts were beautiful and melted in the mouth. I could go into all the details but suffice it to say the food was incredible and the chefs were very enjoyable to sit with. It should be noted that they are freshly opened so a little patience as they figure their service / menu out should be appreciated.

Can't wait to go back!
author: Yoni D.

description: Great environment, we order the salmon and the cod and is really well presented, White rice perfect texture and very good service! We recommend this place since it also has healthy options!
author: David B.

description:
the taste is very fresh and good！
the environment is quiet and clean！
definitely will come next time！
author: Yuying L.

description: They have great, fresh sushi here. Decor is nice and everyone who works there is very nice. The only issue I would say is the wait, you always seem to wait a long time for food so just keep that in mind. HOWEVER, it's really wonderful sushi so it's worth the wait :)
author: Caitlin F.

description: A very clean restaurant with pleasant staff.  The food tasted clean and presented well.  The salmon sashimi melted in my mouth.  The rolls were flavorful with different combinations.    A little noisy, but a great place to have dinner with friends and family.  The food is served fairly quickly.    Parking can be a chore and the street characters may not be appropriate for children.
author: Dennis S.

description: Was pleasantly surprised to have found this gem of a sushi spot in the Haight! I wasn't expecting too much of the place but the quality of fish is pretty good and the prices are pretty reasonable. This will definitely be my go to sushi spot in the neighborhood!
author: kristie k.

description: Very innovative special rolls. It is a good value for money. It is also a nice change in atmosphere from the typical scene on Haight Street--you know what I'm talking about! Will come back in the future.
author: David T.

description: post hike meal. we tried the kaizu roll, ginza, & rainbow roll which all were really good!
author: Rex M.

description: Stopped in after craving sushi and it did not disappoint. Little sis had the Chirashi Bowl, I had the Kaiyo Roll (AMAZING) and the Albacore Belly sushi (melt in your mouth). We shared the Gyoza (which was obviously fresh) and it was delicious. Great inexpensive sushi. Will definitely be returning!
author: A B.

description: I live in the neighborhood and decided to try out this new restaurant. They have the best vegetarian sushi options I've ever seen. Delicious and filling and beautifully presented. The decor is nice and they play good music. The restaurant is spacious. The waitstaff are very nice and take care of you well. I will be coming back here regularly.
author: Kandace B.

description: So good! I seriously smashed my food here! I ordered a spider roll and salmon skin roll and they were perfect. Salmon skin was super crispy and mouthwatering. Miso soup was also perfect. We sat at the bar and the chef working near us was very nice and made us little complimentary appetizers. 10/10 would return :)
author: Sunshine K.

description: Sushi is really fresh and delicious. The baked sushi roll is awesome, but the gyoza is sad (only 5 measly pieces for like $6 or something like that). Overall with the Groupon is pretty worth it. :)
author: Jasmine Y.

description: I came here with a friend, and I had the Uni Udon, while she got a chicken entree. She barely finished her food. While I finished everything on my plate, it was incredibly unfulfilling. My udon was incredibly tiny, the bowl itself was about 6" wide, and there were barely any noodles in it. It was incredibly pricey too! $17 for this tiny bowl of noodles. I thought that it was probably an appetizer at first. I really wasn't full after eating it, and I'm a tiny person. The noodles were also pretty awful, I just didn't want to starve so I finished it all.
author: Julia P.

description:
neighborhood sushi spot! i really enjoy this place even though it's on haight street.
we usually try to sit at the bar and interact with the chef. the sushi is consistently fresh and they have very attentive service. we get 3 rolls and an app (sometimes beer/cocktails) and it ends up around being $65 or so including tip. nice addition to the haight.
author: Angela H.

description: This place is a surprise in Haight. Reasonably priced and actually really fresh fish. Actually good Japanese food in the city is a bit hard to find.
author: Mike C.

description: Great experience here. Ordered the steak and tasted amazing! Great and friendly service as well.
author: Sam S.

description:
I am a big fan of this place, so happy there is finally a good sushi place near me. I've never been disappointed by the sushi rolls or sashimi. Prices are not unreasonable and service is courteous and efficient. Extra points to the staff who held on to my wallet when I left it behind and stayed a little later for me to come back and get it from them. Thank you!

My only request would be for them to expand their drink menu to include cocktails with liquor, but what they have now isn't bad.
author: June O.

description: Fantastic dinner tonight... had Kaiju and Dragon roll - also loved the Uni tasting - Japan beats Santa Barbara this time!
author: John M.

description: Wonderful service and exquisite food to match- our attentive server and manager generously met our needs and we were able to enjoy every bit of our experience despite the rest of our party's no-show. We ended up eating far more than intended but every item was delicious! Started with the popcorn chicken and a lychee sake martini, which was amazing. Followed with a seaweed salad, the dragon & daburu rolls, and finally the green tea ice cream and lava cake. Everything was super fresh and distinctly flavorful- overall quite impressed with this top notch establishment
author: Monica D.

description: This restaurant must have fake reviews. We ordered takeout on the basis of yelp reviews and not only was the sushi awful (fishy smelling and not fresh), we both got sick. Also not cheap for what it is. Do yourself a favor and eat someplace else.
author: Gibu T.

description: A surprisingly charming sushi joint in the haight. We came here for lunch and tried the lunch specials. The portions was very impressive for the price and quality was way better than i expected. (Im typically very picky when it comes to sushi as there are only a few places in the city that I can go back to). The sashimi was incredibly fresh and the rolls were great as well. Got a free lychee ice tea as well with the yelp checkin offer. Would definitely come back.
author: Ray G.

description: great sushi, the rice is made so pure and really melts in mouth.  Service was outstanding as they filled my water 4 or 5 times while there. That's great service. The Dragon roll and Ginza roll were the top choices in my opinion. Area around there a bit shady so keep your guard up walking there at  night. Outstanding food though.
author: Mason M.

description:
Ginza opened up on December 27, 2015 on Haight Street, in a location that formerly housed Kan Zaman and then Great Indian Food.  We have been starved for good restaurants in the Haight, and over the past 5 years we have been getting more options slowly but steadily. 
Ginza fits the mold of the new type of place opening up in the Haight.  I ate there the second night they were open, so I will reserve ultimate judgement, but I am optimistic that I have a solid sushi option less than a block from my house...which would be incredible.  
The sushi was fresh and inventive, and some dishes really shined.  The spicy scallop roll was done a bit differently than normal and it was great, and the edamame with garlic and soy sauce were fantastic.  We had some sake, and the selection was small but nice, though on the expensive side.  In fact, the place in general was a bit more expensive than I expected, though the food was already showing signs of being fresh and well above your average sushi spot. 
Service was friendly and nice, though maybe a bit less than polished.  I wouldn't complain at all though, and it was their second night.  Everyone was sweet and it was a good start.  

Judgment shall be reserved, but let's just say that this place is immediately on my watch list for a local standard.  The only issue I had was that the place was freezing--it's been cold out and it was super cold inside as well.  Hopefully that can be remedied!  

So, let's just sum up what I am trying to say--the place is just getting going, but the first meal I had there on their second day of business was excellent.  Fresh sushi, good drinks, nice staff, solid decor, and a huge upgrade for the neighborhood.  Let's hope they get even better!
author: Blake W.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE! Great ambiance! The food was on point and the service was amazing! For real though, come thru!
author: Isabel D.

description: Great food and fun atmosphere! We ordered gyozas as an appetizer then seven rolls to share between four of us. The amount was perfect! We ordered a few of the unique rolls as well as a few typical ones and all were delicious! Good sake menu as well.
author: Amanda M.

description:
We just did our early one year wedding anniversary here and absolutely loved it.  The service was fantastic and the entire staff is very friendly.  I am glad that we got to beat the crowds that are sure to come in the next few months.  We each ordered the Moriawase and shared the Tomodashi Tartare as an appetizer.  VERY fresh fish that was buttery smooth.  Beautiful presentation too!

I don't like lines or crowds but I will definitely come back here even though I am sure that it will soon be packed as the word spreads about this amazing new spot.

Thanks Ginza for a great meal!
author: Michael N.

description: A friend and I ate here two Sundays ago during their second week open. We both ordered the chef's choice sashimi combo and it took just shy of an hour to come to our table.  It defies comprehension how plain raw fish with nothing else would take so long to come out. For a fleeting moment I had thought about adding rice and gyoza to my order but I had work on Monday. The fish tasted great but god damn, the wait time is unacceptable. We weren't in a rush and there was plenty of sake otherwise we would've left. Tables around us experienced wait times similar or longer. I hope the management reads this. I'd hate to see this place go out of business bc they can't get their shit together.
author: P.J. D.

description: My new favorite sushi place. The rolls are tasty and you can taste the quality. We love their specialty rolls. Yum! Presentation was neat and it was a low key place. The happy hour seems like a sweet deal. Servers were awesome, attentive and not overly so. Love this place!! Yummy tea too.
author: Leah M.

description: I'm so excited that there's finally a tasty, reasonably priced Japanese restaurant in upper Haight! I've tried tons of sushi places in the city and Ginza is definitely one of my favorites. Better yet, it's super affordable and always has plenty of seating. Also.... they have amazing lunch specials.
author: Allison W.

description: Great addition to the Haight! Very fresh, interesting menu, attention to detail from the servers (chilled glass for beer, for example). I've been a bunch of times and keep coming back to try more rolls. Last time, one of the cooks was explaining the significance of eel in Japan and telling stories. I recommend sitting at the bar.
author: Ryan Y.

description:
On a global basis, this isn't a 5-star sushi restaurant but in SF Bay Area it is, since so many of the 4-star rated ones are actually kinda shitty and this place was a definitely a tier above them.  Here is why they are good:

- They don't give you an ENORMOUS piece of fish in their nigiri.  Seriously, I don't understand why so many mediocre sushi places do this.  Is it that hard to cut the piece a little smaller?  It is supposed to be bite-sized, not a huge hunk of fish.  This means their sushi chefs are at least not-clueless.
- The quality (freshness) of the fish was very good.  This is at least pretty par for SF sushi places, even the ones where the chef skill is mediocre.
- The agadashi tofu was actually crunchy on the outside, even after a bit of time being soaked in the broth.  That's impressive.
- They are open on Mondays.  Good for those of us who like to eat sushi on Mondays.
- They are open in the afternoon past 2:30pm.  Good for those of us with irregular schedules who find the "closing at 2/2:30pm" convention of many sushi restaurants infuriating.
- Their tea service is a little fancy.  I don't care too much about tea, but I appreciated it.

Price was commensurate with quality.
author: Yishan W.

description: The sushi taste great, fresh. The size is on a smaller side, especially the ones in the "sushi" section. Service is fast. The list of the items on the menu isn't too long, but there are enough items to choose from.
author: Andrei Y.

description: Very creative rolls, specials and vegetarian options.  We had two vegetarians rolls, a special carpaccio and the dragon roll. Great dinner.  Nice neighborhood
author: Carrie W.

description: Food and customer service was awesome!  Great place to have dinner with friends! 5 stars hands down!
author: Alexio C.

description: So, I want to start by saying ibhave never been disrespected in a restaurant like this as a repeat customer. The food is mediocre at best,but tbeybhave let there location go to there heads on this on. I have Eatin here several times over the years ,but last week will most Definitely be my last. I was there with my partner and our 9 month old son. The bill came , and I paid with my card and went to the restroom to clean my son's bottle. I came out, and my partner was engaging in a verbal argument with our server. I asked him what was going on , and he said our server had disrepected him over us not tipping . I had crossed the line tip out , and she had come back and said that there was not tip, so my partner had circled the tip line I had crossed out and sent it back. She had came back again, saying that the was not tip. My partner explained that we were not tipping. And she told him, loudly, in front of the whole restaurant, if you aren't going to tip, next time, order to go. He told me that out side and I walked back in there an confronted her. What type of customer service is that. Where is there a sign that saying that gratuity it a must. Tipping is never required. You get a pay check honey, maybe if your service was better you would get tipped. I got on her line and most of the patrons seemed to agree. So if you want to be embarrassed, so not tipping mediocre service, this is the place for you.
author: Jessica H.

description:
First the good:

The food is great.  Really, really yummy, solid quality sushi, well prepared and presented. I've been living in the Haight for ten years now and I'm really really excited that we fiiiinally have a sushi restaurant! Good job Ginza people. Thanks for being here. 

You know though, it was 40 bux a plate for dinner, and I get that the restaurant is new, but the wait to get my order was very, very long, even the restaurant was just over half full. 

My biggest complaint is that in this lovely little space they decorated so well, there's a large flat screen television showing sports.  I know that sounds like a petty thing, but for the price, I expect better than the kind of casual atmosphere that Haight Street offers.  It felt like it downgraded the ambiance. 

I think they've got some stuff to work out, but for the moment, the restaurant feels a little overpriced for the experience, even though the food is quite delicious.
author: Becka R.

description: Wonderful time, good rolls! I wish sushi places carried more types of beer but that seems to be normal everywhere.
author: Andrew W.

description: Love this new local sushi spot. Great food, nice staff, never too busy. Lunch specials are really great for the large amount of food. Rainbow and spicy tuna rolls are delish
author: Ajj J.

description: T is a fantastic sushi chef! I'm so happy we have a sushi restaurant in the haight now. The sushi is delicious. Definitely a neighborhood favorite and I'll be back tomorrow. Sooo stoked. The sushi is so fresh and gets freshly caught and delivered here daily :) the new vibe is so prime
author: Mark M.

description: really pricy for what we got. very drafty so bring a jacket
author: Katherine Q.

description: Excellent sushi, atmosphere,  pricing, and service. I was alone and didn't have drinks, so I ordered lemonade. It was too sweet for my tastes,  but the waitress told me that when I ordered,  so I expected that.  I ordered a kaiyo roll (as it was recommended here on Yelp). It came quickly (this was evening,  around 7 pm, but not awfully busy) and was very good.  It has a crunchiness that I liked.
author: Sam H.

description:
Living in the Haight, sushi has never been an option at our doorsteps.  We frequently found ourselves having to journey to other parts of the city for our fix.  Thank you so much Ginza for changing that.  We now have a solid sushi option just a few blocks away :-).

Last night, we checked our Ginza for the first time.  From what the server told us, they have been open for about a month at this point.  First of all, the quality of the fish was excellent.  We went with some classics...the Dragon roll was excellent and our favorite.  Their spicy tuna was excellent and the spicy mayo rivaled my absolute favorite of all time (Yama sushi in NYC).  We even tried a veggie roll (Jiyugaoka), which while not the norm for us, was also excellent.  We rounded things out with Miso soup (hard to go wrong there) and veggie gyoza, which were tasty and had the perfect noodle texture.

The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive and even shouted to customers as they left the tradition farewell of "arigatou gozaimasu", which made me feel like I was back in Tokyo.

Welcome to the neighborhood, Ginza!  Happy to have you!
author: Marc P.

description: Great service and food.  Sushi was fresh and portion sizes were appropriate.  Price was reasonable for quality sushi dinner for 4 (with multiple drinks and tip ~$170).  Hats off to the owner, chefs and staff.  An enjoyable experience.
author: Mike P.

description: Nice atmosphere, great location, really yummy sushi and great prices for lunch! Quick survive highly recommend
author: Hannah W.

description: Went in last night due to good reviews on Yelp. Disappointed. Tried the two first signature rolls. The first one was good but the second was average. Then we had their chicken entree which tasted greasy. The skin on was crispy though. The other entree was the scallops which were served in a rice bowl. Definitely, I don't recommend this dish. It was again greasy, with a burnt garlic oil taste. Young crowd...
author: Huy T.

description: This place is fantastic! The best restaurant to come to upper Haight in years. Service is on point, food is scrumptious and the ambiance is divine! Great for dates or a nice dinner with friends.
author: Benjamin R.

description: Good service and excellent menus. Food was well prepared and very tasty. I will return.
author: Jim B.

description:
I am really happy a good Japanese restaurant is on haight st. I highly recommend the tempura. It's not the typical onion and potato tempura- it has lotus root, green onion, purple potatos, etc. we arrived rather late and the batter was still bright and not weird and yellow. 

The chefs choice was also delicious - a few surprises and all really fresh - a delicious sweet shrimp with the head fried on the side.  

Portions were worth the price.
author: Bird E.

description: Really enjoyed the sushi here. I wish they had a little more variety on the menu.. But there were still a ton of options. Over all the quality was great and the atmosphere pleasant.
author: Annie C.

description: Great sushi, very good happy hour. This place just opened up right near my house, and I couldn't be more excited about having a quality sushi restaurant near my house.
author: Kevin R.

description: I had a good experience at this restaurant. I really liked the lychee iced tea and akairo rolls were really good and I recommend trying them. The waitress Lisa was extremely helpful in choosing from the menu.
author: Ryan J.

description: Great service from Lisa, and great food. We ordered the agedashi tofu, which was a great appetizer. Not too fried, which we liked. The rolls were great as well. I didn't get to try the nigiri pieces, but looking over at the table next to ours, they looked great and well prepared.
author: Eugene K.

description: Ordered takeout and had a beer while I waited. Good sushi, friendly service and really great prices. The house music was a little odd when I was there but maybe after a few saki bombs it works (?).
author: Tim Y.

description: The rolls were fresh and reasonably priced. We called ahead on a Tuesday night and reserved a table for five. The service was fine, but the restaurant filled up while during our visit. The soup and appetizers were brought out quickly. It took awhile to get our rolls because the two sushi chefs were extremely busy.
author: Marc H.

description: I don't know how this place has so many stars For the price I expected a lot more. Small rolls, little flavor. Oysters didn't taste very fresh.
author: Liz S.

description: Love the vibe candles on the table quiet. servers continually ask if we needed anything and kept refilling our water  it's really expensive for such small rolls and flavor was ok it's a nice place to go on a romantic date but be prepared to pay a pretty penny
author: Crystal C.

description: Bruh it took an hour to get an undersized roll. Rolls are $11 and up and don't taste especially flavorful.
author: Nick P.

description: Really great selection of sushi rolls. We came around 9pm and ordered more to-go, staff was extremely generous and they gave us an extra roll on the house. Highly recommend this place if you're looking for high quality sushi!
author: Joyce L.

description: My boyfriend has been going here since the day they opened their doors (no really he worked from home that day and went for lunch). Not only is the fish extremely fresh and decently priced, all of the employees are adorable and amazing. The Haight was in some serious need of decent sushi and Ginza is everything we could have dreamed of and more. In fact, I'm ordering pick up tonight because I can't stop thinking about their delicious rolls and sashimi - YUM!
author: Erin D.

description: This place is such a welcome addition to the haight area which is sorely lacking in sushi places. Great lunch specials, we ordered a roll combo ($11) and sashimi/sushi bento combo ($18) which came with a tuna roll, california roll and rainbow roll (you can also select a dragon roll or the chef special instead) for the roll combo or 4 pieces of nigiri and 6 pieces of sashimi plus tempura for the bento combo, and the standard miso soup. Considering how fresh and tasty the fish was and the quantity of food, thought this was a great deal. The decor is also quite a step up from most other places in the hood, modern and stylish, I could see this being a cozy date spot. Would recommend this place if you live nearby or are in the hood!
author: Valerie C.

description: Amazing sushi! Amazing quality ingredients. Ordered maguro, sake and hamachi sashimi Freshness of the fish speak for itself.
author: Tamny T.

description: My partner and I have been eating sushi at least once a week for, well, a long time. Koo on Irving has long been our favorite, but when Ginza opened just a block away we thought we'd give it a try, maybe for this times we didn't want to hunt for parking near Koo. Got some take out and thought it was surprisingly good, so went there for a full dinner. Simply excellent, every course. Got a dozen oysters, fresh, briny, lightly but well seasoned, and only $1.50 each before 6. (we walked in at 5:59 and they still gave us the deal.)  Tempura was served hot, greaseless, excellent batter, the shrimp still moist and not overcooked as if often the case at even the better Japanese.  All the nigiri was glistening, but the tuna toro and the yellowtail toro were outstanding, creamy, melt in your mouth texture from the belly fat, just wonderful.  Even the green tea and miso were top notch, not just an afterthought.   Highly recommended.
author: Greg R.

description: The sushi was nice and fresh. The $10 Cod Tasting special was great. I really hope they put it on the menu full time at some point. We enjoyed the Clams in Yuzu broth with Garlic toast. Its a nice space with good service. I'll definitely be back with friends.
author: Tony M.

description: Definitely a great place for Sushi. The Gyu Steak was super good and had lots of flavor. The Daburu roll was also very fresh and the flavor was perfect. Our waitress Lisa was also super top notch and was very nice. She even held the door open for us as we left. Overall it was a great experience and I would go again. Meow!
author: Jordan L.

description: As expensive as other Sushi places like Otoro but not that good...waitresses were also not smily at all...
author: Jean C.

description: Couldn't be happier to have a sushi the place in the Haight - highly recommend the Moriawase!
author: Hayley D.
